original: om ity etad akṣaram udgītham upāsīta /
analyzed: om iti etat akṣaram udgītham upāsīta
translated: One should meditate on the syllable Om as the Udgitha.

analyzed: om iti hi udgāyati
translated: For with Om one sings.

original: tasyopavyākhyānam // / / //🔽eṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ pṛthivī rasaḥ /🔽pṛthivyā āpo rasaḥ /
analyzed: tasya upavyākhyānam  eṣām bhūtānām pṛthivī rasaḥ  pṛthivyāḥ āpaḥ rasaḥ
translated: Its exposition is this.🔽Of these beings, earth is the essence.🔽Of earth, water is the essence.

analyzed: apām oṣadhayaḥ rasaḥ  oṣadhīnām puruṣaḥ rasaḥ
translated: Of water, plants are the essence.🔽Of plants, man is the essence.

analyzed: puruṣasya vāc rasaḥ  vācaḥ ṛc rasaḥ
translated: Of man, speech is the essence.🔽Of speech, the Rig-Veda is the essence.

analyzed: ṛcaḥ sāma rasaḥ
translated: Of the Rig-Veda, the Saman-Veda is the essence.

analyzed: sāmnaḥ udgīthaḥ rasaḥ
translated: Of the Saman-Veda, the Udgitha is the essence.

original: sa eṣa rasānāṃ rasatamaḥ paramaḥ parārdhyo 'ṣṭamo yadudgīthaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ eṣa rasānām rasatamaḥ paramaḥ parārdhyaḥ ṣṭamaḥ yat udgīthaḥ
translated: This is the essence of essences, the highest, the most excellent, the eighth, namely, the Udgitha.🔽Which is which Rig-Veda? Which is which Saman-Veda? Which is which Udgitha? This is considered.

original: katamā katama rk katamat katamat sāma katamaḥ katama udgītha iti vimṛṣṭaṃ bhavati // / / //🔽vāg evark /
analyzed: katamā katamā ṛc katamat katamat sāma katamaḥ katamaḥ udgīthaḥ iti vimṛṣṭam bhavati  vāc eva ṛc
translated: Speech itself is the Rig-Veda.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ sāma
translated: The life-breath is the Saman-Veda.

analyzed: om iti etat akṣaram udgīthaḥ
translated: The syllable Om is the Udgitha.

original: tad vā etan mithunaṃ yad vāk ca prāṇaś cark ca sāma ca // / / //
analyzed: tat vai etat mithunam yat vāc ca prāṇaḥ ca ṛc ca sāma ca
translated: This pair, namely, speech and life-breath, Rig-Veda and Saman-Veda,

original: tad etan mithunam om ity etasminn akṣare saṃsṛjyate /
analyzed: tat etat mithunam om iti etasmin akṣare saṃsṛjyate
translated: this pair is united in this syllable Om.

original: yadā vai mithunau samāgacchata āpayato vai tāv anyo 'nyasya kāmam // / / //
analyzed: yadā vai mithunau samāgacchataḥ āpayataḥ vai tau anyaḥ nyasya kāmam
translated: When a pair comes together, they fulfill each other's desire.

original: āpayitā ha vai kāmānāṃ bhavati ya etad evaṃ vidvān akṣaram udgītham upāste // / / //
analyzed: āpayitā ha vai kāmānām bhavati yaḥ etat evam vidvān akṣaram udgītham upāste
translated: He who, knowing this thus, reverences the syllable Om as the Udgītha, becomes the fulfiller of desires.

analyzed: tat vai etat anujñā akṣaram
translated: This syllable Om is the permission.

original: yad dhi kiṃcānujānāty om ity eva tad āha /
analyzed: yat hi kiṃca anujānāti om iti eva tat āha
translated: Whatever one permits, one says 'Om' to it.

analyzed: eṣā u eva samṛddhiḥ yat anujñā
translated: This very permission is prosperity.

original: samardhayitā ha vai kāmānāṃ bhavati ya etad evaṃ vidvān akṣaram udgītham upāste // / / //
analyzed: samardhayitā ha vai kāmānām bhavati yaḥ etat evam vidvān akṣaram udgītham upāste
translated: He who, knowing this thus, reverences the syllable Om as the Udgītha, becomes the fulfiller of desires.

original: teneyaṃ trayī vidyā vartate /🔽om ity āśrāvayati /🔽om iti śaṃsati /
analyzed: tena iyam trayī vidyā vartate  om iti āśrāvayati  om iti śaṃsati
translated: By it this threefold knowledge proceeds.🔽With 'Om' he causes to announce.🔽With 'Om' he recites.

analyzed: om iti udgāyati
translated: With 'Om' he chants.

analyzed: etasya eva akṣarasya apacityai mahimnā rasena
translated: For the glorification of this very syllable, by its greatness, by its essence,

analyzed: tena ubhau kurutaḥ
translated: by it both do.

original: yaś caitad evaṃ veda yaś ca na veda /
analyzed: yaḥ ca etat evam veda yaḥ ca na veda
translated: He who knows this thus and he who does not.

analyzed: nānā tu vidyā ca avidyā ca
translated: But knowledge and ignorance are different.

original: yad eva vidyayā karoti śraddhayopaniṣadā tad eva vīryavattaraṃ bhavatīti khalv etasyaivākṣarasyopavyākhyānaṃ bhavati // / / //
analyzed: yat eva vidyayā karoti śraddhayā upaniṣadā tat eva vīryavattaram bhavati iti khalu etasya eva akṣarasya upavyākhyānam bhavati
translated: Whatever one does with knowledge, with faith, with the Upanishad, that becomes most effective. Thus indeed is the explanation of this very syllable.

analyzed: deva asurāḥ ha vai yatra saṃyetire
translated: The gods and demons, indeed, where they met together,

original: ubhaye prājāpatyās tad dha devā udgītham ājahrur anenainān abhibhaviṣyāma iti // / / //
analyzed: ubhaye prājāpatyāḥ tat ha devāḥ udgītham ājahruḥ anena enān abhibhaviṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: The two are Prajapati's. The gods took up the Udgitha, thinking, 'By this we shall overcome them.'

original: te ha nāsikyaṃ prāṇam udgītham upāsāṃ cakrire /
analyzed: te ha nāsikyam prāṇam udgītham upāsām cakrire
translated: They meditated on the breath in the nose as the Udgitha.

analyzed: tam ha asurāḥ pāpmanā vividhuḥ
translated: The Asuras pierced it with evil.

original: tasmāt tenobhayaṃ jighrati surabhi ca durgandhi ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tena ubhayam jighrati surabhi ca durgandhi ca
translated: Therefore, by it one smells both what is fragrant and what is foul-smelling,

analyzed: pāpmanā hi eṣa viddhaḥ
translated: for it is pierced by evil.

original: atha ha vācam udgītham upāsāṃ cakrire /
analyzed: atha ha vācam udgītham upāsām cakrire
translated: Then they meditated on speech as the Udgitha.

analyzed: tām ha asurāḥ pāpmanā vividhuḥ
translated: The Asuras pierced it with evil.

original: tasmāt tayobhayaṃ vadati satyaṃ cānṛtaṃ ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tayā ubhayam vadati satyam ca anṛtam ca
translated: Therefore, by it one speaks both what is true and what is false,

analyzed: pāpmanā hi eṣā viddhā
translated: for it is pierced by evil.

original: atha ha cakṣur udgītham upāsāṃ cakrire /
analyzed: atha ha cakṣuḥ udgītham upāsām cakrire
translated: Then they meditated on the eye as the Udgitha.

analyzed: tat ha asurāḥ pāpmanā vividhuḥ
translated: The Asuras pierced it with evil.

original: tasmāt tenobhayaṃ paśyati darśanīyaṃ cādarśanīyaṃ ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tena ubhayam paśyati darśanīyam ca a darśanīyam ca
translated: Therefore, by it one sees both what is beautiful to behold and what is not beautiful to behold,

analyzed: pāpmanā hi etat viddham
translated: for it is pierced by evil.

original: atha ha śrotram udgītham upāsāṃ cakrire /
analyzed: atha ha śrotram udgītham upāsām cakrire
translated: Then they meditated on the ear as the Udgitha.

analyzed: tat ha asurāḥ pāpmanā vividhuḥ
translated: The Asuras pierced it with evil.

original: tasmāt tenobhayaṃ śṛṇoti śravaṇīyaṃ cāśravaṇīyaṃ ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tena ubhayam śṛṇoti śravaṇīyam ca a śravaṇīyam ca
translated: Therefore, by it one hears both what is worth hearing and what is not worth hearing,

analyzed: pāpmanā hi etat viddham
translated: for it is pierced by evil.

original: atha ha mana udgītham upāsāṃ cakrire /
analyzed: atha ha manaḥ udgītham upāsām cakrire
translated: Then they meditated on the Udgītha as the mind.

analyzed: tat ha asurāḥ pāpmanā vividhuḥ
translated: The Asuras pierced that with evil.

analyzed: tasmāt tena ubhayam saṃkalpayate saṃkalpanīyam ca
translated: Therefore, by it one resolves both what is to be resolved and what is not to be resolved.

original: pāpmanā hy etad viddham // / / //🔽atha ha ya evāyaṃ mukhyaḥ prāṇas tam udgītham upāsāṃ cakrire /
analyzed: pāpmanā hi etat viddham  atha ha yaḥ eva ayam mukhyaḥ prāṇaḥ tam udgītham upāsām cakrire
translated: for it is pierced by evil.🔽Then they meditated on the Udgītha as the chief life-breath.

original: taṃ hāsurā ṛtvā vidadhvaṃsur yathāśmānam ākhaṇam ṛtvā vidhvaṃsetaivam // / / //
analyzed: tam ha asurāḥ ṛtvā vidadhvaṃsuḥ yathā aśmānam ākhaṇam ṛtvā vidhvaṃseta evam
translated: The Asuras, having approached it, destroyed it, as one would destroy a stone by approaching it.

original: evaṃ yathāśmānam ākhaṇam ṛtvā vidhvaṃsata evaṃ haiva sa vidhvaṃsate ya evaṃvidi pāpaṃ kāmayate yaś cainam abhidāsati /
analyzed: evam yathā aśmānam ākhaṇam ṛtvā vidhvaṃsate evam ha eva sa vidhvaṃsate yaḥ evaṃvidi pāpam kāmayate yaḥ ca enam abhidāsati
translated: Even so, just as a stone would be destroyed by approaching it, so is he destroyed, who, knowing this, desires evil, and he who injures him.

analyzed: saḥ eṣaḥ śma ākhaṇaḥ
translated: This is that stone which is not to be approached.

analyzed: na eva etena surabhi na durgandhi vijānāti
translated: He does not know what is fragrant or foul-smelling by this.

analyzed: apahata pāpmā hi eṣaḥ
translated: For he is free from evil.

original: tena yad aśnāti yat pibati tenetarān prāṇān avati /
analyzed: tena yat aśnāti yat pibati tena itarān prāṇān avati
translated: By it, whatever he eats, whatever he drinks, thereby he sustains the other life-breaths.

analyzed: etam u eva antatas vittvā utkrāmati
translated: In the end, not having known this, he departs.

analyzed: vyādadāti eva antatas iti
translated: He opens up in the end.

analyzed: tam ha aṅgirāḥ udgītham upāsām cakre
translated: Aṅgiras meditated on the Udgītha as that.

original: etam u evāṅgirasaṃ manyante 'ṅgānāṃ yad rasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: etam u eva āṅgirasam manyante ṅgānām yat rasaḥ
translated: They consider that Aṅgiras to be the essence of the limbs.

original: tena taṃ ha bṛhaspatir udgītham upāsāṃ cakre /🔽etam u eva bṛhaspatiṃ manyante /
analyzed: tena tam ha bṛhaspatiḥ udgītham upāsām cakre  etam u eva bṛhaspatim manyante
translated: By that, indeed, Brihaspati meditated upon the Udgītha.🔽They consider that Brihaspati to be the same.

analyzed: vāc ghi bṛhatī tasyāḥ eṣa patiḥ
translated: For speech is great, and he is the lord of that.

original: tena taṃ hāyāsya udgītham upāsāṃ cakre /
analyzed: tena tam ha ayāsyaḥ udgītham upāsām cakre
translated: By that, indeed, Āyāsy meditated upon the Udgītha.

analyzed: etam u eva ayāsyam manyante
translated: They consider that Āyāsy to be the same.

analyzed: āsyāt yat ayate
translated: For what goes out from the mouth.

original: tena taṃ ha bako dālbhyo vidāṃ cakāra /
analyzed: tena tam ha bakaḥ dālbhyaḥ vidām cakāra
translated: By that, indeed, Baka Dālbhya knew.

original: sa ha naimiśīyānām udgātā babhūva /🔽sa ha smaibhyaḥ kāmān āgāyati // / / //
analyzed: sa ha naimiśīyānām udgātā babhūva  sa ha sma ebhyaḥ kāmān āgāyati
translated: He became the Udgātṛ of the Naimiṣīyas.🔽He used to sing desires for them.

original: āgātā ha vai kāmānāṃ bhavati ya etad evaṃ vidvān akṣaram udgītham upāste /
analyzed: āgātā ha vai kāmānām bhavati yaḥ etat evam vidvān akṣaram udgītham upāste
translated: One who, knowing thus, meditates upon that syllable, the Udgītha, as the Self, becomes a singer of desires.

analyzed: iti adhyātmam
translated: Thus, in regard to the Self.

original: athādhidaivatam /🔽ya evāsau tapati tam udgītham upāsīta /
analyzed: atha adhidaivatam  yaḥ eva asau tapati tam udgītham upāsīta
translated: Now, in regard to the Deities.🔽One should meditate upon that which shines as the Udgītha.

original: udyan vā eṣa prajābhya udgāyati /🔽udyaṃs tamo bhayam apahanti /
analyzed: udyan vai eṣa prajābhyaḥ udgāyati  udyan tamaḥ bhayam apahanti
translated: Rising, he sings for the people.🔽Rising, he removes the fear of darkness.

original: apahantā ha vai bhayasya tamaso bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: apahantā ha vai bhayasya tamasaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: One who knows thus becomes the remover of the fear of darkness.

analyzed: samānaḥ u eva ayam ca asau ca
translated: This one and that one are the same.

analyzed: uṣṇaḥ yam uṣṇaḥ sau
translated: This one is hot, that one is hot.

original: svara itīmam ācakṣate svara iti pratyāsvara ity amum /
analyzed: svaraḥ iti imam ācakṣate svaraḥ iti pratyāsvaraḥ iti amum
translated: This one is called Svara, and that one Pratyasvara.

original: tasmād vā etam imam amuṃ ca udgītham upāsīta // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt vai etam imam amum ca udgītham upāsīta
translated: Therefore one should meditate upon this one and that one as Udgītha.

analyzed: atha khalu vyānam eva udgītham upāsīta
translated: Now, verily, one should meditate upon Vyāna as Udgītha.

analyzed: yat vai prāṇiti sa prāṇaḥ
translated: What is Prāṇa (inhalation), that is Prāṇa.

analyzed: yat apāniti saḥ u pānaḥ
translated: What is Apāna (exhalation), that is Apāna.

original: atha yaḥ prāṇāpānayoḥ saṃdhiḥ sa vyānaḥ /
analyzed: atha yaḥ prāṇa apānayoḥ saṃdhiḥ sa vyānaḥ
translated: Now, that which is the junction of Prāṇa and Apāna, that is Vyāna.

analyzed: yaḥ vyānaḥ sā vāc
translated: What is Vyāna, that is Speech.

analyzed: tasmāt a prāṇan an apānan vācam abhivyāharati
translated: Therefore, without Prāṇa and without Apāna, one utters speech.

analyzed: yā vāc sā ṛc
translated: What is Speech, that is Ṛk.

analyzed: tasmāt a prāṇan an apānan ṛcam abhivyāharati
translated: Therefore, without Prāṇa and without Apāna, one utters Ṛk.

analyzed: yā ṛc tat sāma
translated: What is Ṛk, that is Sāman.

analyzed: tasmāt a prāṇan an apānan sāma gāyati
translated: Therefore, without Prāṇa and without Apāna, one sings Sāman.

analyzed: yat sāma saḥ udgīthaḥ
translated: What is Sāman, that is Udgītha.

original: tasmād aprānann anapānann udgāyati // / / //🔽ato yāny anyāni vīryavanti karmāṇi yathāgner manthanam ājeḥ saraṇaṃ dṛḍhasya dhanuṣa āyamanam aprāṇann anapānaṃs tāni karoti /
analyzed: tasmāt a prānan an apānan udgāyati  atas yāni anyāni vīryavanti karmāṇi yathā agneḥ manthanam ājeḥ saraṇam dṛḍhasya dhanuṣaḥ āyamanam a prāṇan an apānan tāni karoti
translated: Therefore, without Prāṇa and without Apāna, one chants Udgītha.

analyzed: etasya hetoḥ vyānam eva udgītham upāsīta
translated: For this reason, one should meditate upon Vyāna as Udgītha.

analyzed: atha khalu udgītha akṣarāṇi upāsīta udgīthaḥ iti
translated: Now, verily, one should meditate upon the syllables of the Udgītha, as Udgītha.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ eva ud
translated: The breath itself is 'ut'.

analyzed: prāṇena hi uttiṣṭhati
translated: For by the breath one rises.

analyzed: vak gīḥ
translated: The song is 'gi'.

analyzed: vācaḥ ha giraḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: For speech they call 'gi'.

analyzed: annam tham
translated: The food is 'tham'.

analyzed: anne hi idam sarvam sthitam
translated: For on food this all rests.

analyzed: dyauḥ eva ud
translated: The heaven itself is 'ut'.

analyzed: antarikṣam gīḥ
translated: The atmosphere is 'gi'.

analyzed: pṛthivī tham
translated: The earth is 'tham'.

analyzed: ādityaḥ eva ud  vāyuḥ gīḥ
translated: The sun itself is 'ut'.🔽The wind is 'gi'.

analyzed: agniḥ tham
translated: The fire is 'tham'.

analyzed: sāmavedaḥ eva u t
translated: The Sāma Veda itself is 'ut'.

analyzed: yajurvedaḥ gīḥ
translated: The Yajur Veda is 'gi'.

analyzed: ṛgvedaḥ tham
translated: The Ṛg Veda is 'tham'.

original: dugdhe 'smai vāg dohaṃ yo vāco dohaḥ /
analyzed: dugdhe smai vāc doham yaḥ vācaḥ dohaḥ
translated: For him who knows these syllables of the Udgītha thus, speech milks the milk of speech,

analyzed: annavān anna ādaḥ bhavati
translated: he becomes possessed of food, an eater of food.

original: ya etāny evaṃ vidvān udgīthākṣarāṇy upāsta udgītha iti // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ etāni evam vidvān udgītha akṣarāṇi upāste udgīthaḥ iti
translated: He who thus knows these syllables of the Udgītha as the Udgītha.

analyzed: atha khalu āśīḥ samṛddhiḥ
translated: Now, indeed, the blessing is prosperity.

original: upasaraṇānīty upāsīta /🔽yena sāmnā stoṣyan syāt tat sāmopadhāvet // / / //
analyzed: upasaraṇāni iti upāsīta  yena sāmnā stoṣyan syāt tat sāma upadhāvet
translated: One should meditate on them as the approaches.🔽One should approach that Sāman by which one is going to chant.

original: yasyām ṛci tām ṛcaṃ /🔽yad ārṣeyaṃ tam ṛṣiṃ /
analyzed: yasyām ṛci tām ṛcam  yat ārṣeyam tam ṛṣim
translated: That Ṛc in which (the Sāman is contained), that Ṛc.🔽That Ṛṣi in whose Ṛṣi (the Sāman is contained), that Ṛṣi.

original: yāṃ devatām abhiṣṭoṣyan syāt tāṃ devatām upadhāvet // / / //🔽yena cchandasā stoṣyan syāt tac chanda upadhāvet /
analyzed: yām devatām abhiṣṭoṣyan syāt tām devatām upadhāvet  yena chandasā stoṣyan syāt tat chandaḥ upadhāvet
translated: That deity which one is going to chant, that deity one should approach.🔽That metre by which one is going to chant, that metre one should approach.

original: yena stomena stoṣyamāṇaḥ syāt taṃ stomam upadhāvet // / / //
analyzed: yena stomena stoṣyamāṇaḥ syāt tam stomam upadhāvet
translated: That Stoma by which one is going to chant, that Stoma one should approach.

original: yāṃ diśam abhiṣṭoṣyan syāt tāṃ diśam upadhāvet // / / //
analyzed: yām diśam abhiṣṭoṣyan syāt tām diśam upadhāvet
translated: In whatever direction he wishes to chant, he should run towards that direction.

original: ātmānam antata upasṛtya stuvīta kāmaṃ dhyāyann apramattaḥ /
analyzed: ātmānam antatas upasṛtya stuvīta kāmam dhyāyan apramattaḥ
translated: Having approached the end of himself, he should chant, meditating on his desire, being heedful.

original: abhyāśo ha yad asmai sa kāmaḥ smṛdhyeta yatkāmaḥ stuvīteti yatkāmaḥ stuvīteti // / / //
analyzed: abhyāśaḥ ha yat asmai sa kāmaḥ smṛdhyeta yad kāmaḥ stuvīta iti yad kāmaḥ stuvīta iti
translated: For, indeed, that desire of his which he has in mind when he chants, that desire of his is fulfilled, whatever it may be.

original: om ity etad akṣaram udgītham upāsīta /
analyzed: om iti etat akṣaram udgītham upāsīta
translated: One should meditate on the syllable Om as the Udgitha.

analyzed: om iti hi udgāyati
translated: For with Om they chant.

analyzed: tasya upavyākhyānam
translated: Its exposition is as follows:

original: devā vai mṛtyor bibhyatas trayīṃ vidyāṃ prāviśan /
analyzed: devāḥ vai mṛtyoḥ bibhyataḥ trayīm vidyām prāviśan
translated: The gods, being afraid of death, entered the three Vedas.

analyzed: te chandobhiḥ acchādayan
translated: They covered them with the metres.

original: yad ebhir acchādayaṃs tac chandasāṃ chandastvam // / / //
analyzed: yat ebhiḥ acchādayan tat chandasām chandaḥ tvam
translated: In that they covered them with these, that is the metre-ness of the metres.

original: tān u tatra mṛtyur yathā matsyam udake paripaśyed evaṃ paryapaśyad ṛci sāmni yajuṣi /
analyzed: tān u tatra mṛtyuḥ yathā matsyam udake paripaśyet evam paryapaśyat ṛci sāmni yajuṣi
translated: There, indeed, death saw them as one might see a fish in the water, in the Ṛc, Sāman, and Yajuṣ.

original: te nu vittvordhvā ṛcaḥ sāmno yajuṣaḥ svaram eva prāviśan // / / //
analyzed: te nu vittvā ūrdhvāḥ ṛcaḥ sāmnaḥ yajuṣaḥ svaram eva prāviśan
translated: Having known this, they went upwards from the Ṛc, Sāman, and Yajuṣ, and entered the tone.

original: yadā vā ṛcam āpnoty om ity evātisvarati evaṃ sāmaivaṃ yajuḥ /
analyzed: yadā vai ṛcam āpnoti om iti eva atisvarati evam sāma evam yajuḥ
translated: When one reaches the Ṛc, one chants with Om. Thus the Sāman, thus the Yajuṣ.

analyzed: tāḥ amṛtāḥ āpaḥ  te vai ete tharva aṅgirasaḥ etat itihāsa pūrāṇam abhyatapan
translated: and the nectar is the water.🔽Those Atharva-Angiras indeed heated this Itihasa-Purana.

original: tasyābhitaptasya yaśas teja indriyāṃ vīryam annādyaṃ raso 'jāyata // / / //
analyzed: tasya abhitaptasya yaśaḥ tejaḥ indriyām vīryam annādyam rasaḥ jāyata

analyzed: tat vyakṣarat

analyzed: tat ādityam abhitas śrayat

original: tad vā etad yad etad ādityasya paraḥkṛṣṇaṃ rūpam // / / //

analyzed: guhyāḥ eva ādeśāḥ madhukṛtaḥ
translated: the secret instructions are the makers of the honey,

analyzed: brahma eva puṣpam
translated: Brahman itself is the flower,

analyzed: tāḥ amṛtāḥ āpaḥ
translated: and the nectar is the water.

original: te vā ete guhyā ādeśā etad brahmābhyatapan /
analyzed: te vai ete guhyāḥ ādeśāḥ etat brahma abhyatapan
translated: Those secret instructions indeed heated that Brahman.

original: tasyābhitaptasya yaśas teja indriyaṃ vīryam annādyaṃ raso 'jāyata // / / //
analyzed: tasya abhitaptasya yaśaḥ tejaḥ indriyam vīryam annādyam rasaḥ jāyata
translated: From it, when heated, the essence arose, namely, glory, splendor, faculties, strength, and food.

analyzed: tat vyakṣarat 🔽tat ādityam abhitas śrayat
translated: It flowed out.🔽It settled around the sun.

analyzed: tat vai etat yat etat ādityasya madhye kṣobhate iva

analyzed: te vai ete rasānām rasāḥ

analyzed: vedāḥ hi rasāḥ
translated: For the Vedas are the essences.

analyzed: teṣām ete rasāḥ

analyzed: tāni vai etāni amṛtānām amṛtāni
translated: These are the immoralities of the immoralities.

analyzed: vedāḥ hi amṛtāḥ
translated: For the Vedas are the immoralities.

analyzed: teṣām etāni amṛtāni
translated: Of them, these are the immoralities.

original: tad yat prathamam amṛtaṃ tad vasava upajīvanty agninā mukhena /
analyzed: tat yat prathamam amṛtam tat vasavaḥ upajīvanti agninā mukhena

original: na vai devā aśnanti na pibanti /
analyzed: na vai devāḥ aśnanti na pibanti

analyzed: etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti

analyzed: te etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udyanti
translated: From this form they rise up.

analyzed: sa yaḥ etat evam amṛtam veda vasūnām eva ekaḥ bhūtvā agninā eva mukhena etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyati
translated: He who knows this immortality thus, becoming one of the Vasus, with Agni as his mouth, being satisfied by seeing this very immortality,

analyzed: saḥ etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśati
translated: he enters into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udeti
translated: From this form he rises up.

original: sa yāvad ādityaḥ purastād udetā paścād astam etā vasūnām eva tāvad ādhipatyaṃ svārājyaṃ paryetā // / / //

translated: As long as the sun rises in the east and sets in the west, for so long he has attained the lordship and sovereignty of the Vasus.

original: atha yad dvitīyam amṛtaṃ tad rudrā upajīvantīndreṇa mukhena /
analyzed: atha yat dvitīyam amṛtam tat rudrāḥ upajīvanti indreṇa mukhena

original: na vai devā aśnanti na pibanti /
analyzed: na vai devāḥ aśnanti na pibanti
translated: The gods do not eat or drink.

analyzed: etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti
translated: Having seen this very nectar, they are satisfied.

analyzed: te etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti
translated: They enter into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udyanti
translated: They rise from this form.

original: sa ya etad evam amṛtaṃ veda rudrāṇām evaiko bhūtvendreṇaiva mukhenaitad evāmṛtaṃ dṛṣṭvā tṛpyati /

translated: He who knows this nectar thus, becomes one of the Rudras themselves, with Indra as their mouth, and is satisfied by seeing this very nectar.

analyzed: saḥ etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśati
translated: He enters into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udeti
translated: He rises from this form.

analyzed: sa yāvat ādityaḥ purastāt udetā paścāt astam etāḥ dvis tāvat dakṣiṇatas udetā uttaratas stam etāḥ rudrāṇām eva tāvat ādhipatyam svārājyam paryetā
translated: As long as the sun rises in the east and sets in the west, twice as long it rises in the south and sets in the north. For so long he obtains the lordship and self-rule of the Rudras.

original: atha yat tṛtīyam amṛtaṃ tad ādityā upajīvanti varuṇena mukhena /
analyzed: atha yat tṛtīyam amṛtam tat ādityāḥ upajīvanti varuṇena mukhena
translated: Now, the third nectar, the Adityas live on that, with Varuna as their mouth.

original: na vai devā aśnanti na pibanti /
analyzed: na vai devāḥ aśnanti na pibanti
translated: The gods do not eat or drink.

original: etad evāmṛtaṃ dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti // / / //🔽ta etad eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti /
analyzed: etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti  te etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti
translated: Having seen this very nectar, they are satisfied.🔽They enter into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udyanti
translated: They rise from this form.

analyzed: saḥ etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśati
translated: He enters into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udeti
translated: From this form he rises up.

original: sa yāvad ādityo dakṣiṇata udetottarato 'stam etā dvis tāvat paścād udetā purastād astam etādityānām eva tāvad ādhipatyaṃ svārājyaṃ paryetā
analyzed: sa yāvat ādityaḥ dakṣiṇatas udetā uttaratas stam etāḥ dvis tāvat paścāt udetā purastāt astam etā ādityānām eva tāvat ādhipatyam svārājyam paryetā
translated: As long as the sun rises in the south and sets in the north, twice as long it rises in the west and sets in the east. To that extent he attains lordship over the Ādityas and sovereignty over self.

analyzed: atha yat caturtham amṛtam tat marutaḥ upajīvanti somena mukhena
translated: Now, the fourth immortal [element] which the Maruts live on by means of Soma as their mouth,

original: na vai devā aśnanti na pibanti /
analyzed: na vai devāḥ aśnanti na pibanti
translated: the gods do not eat nor do they drink.

analyzed: etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti
translated: By seeing this very immortal [element] they are satisfied.

analyzed: te etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti
translated: They enter into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udyanti
translated: From this form they rise up.

analyzed: sa yaḥ etat evam amṛtam veda marutām eva ekaḥ bhūtvā somena eva mukhena etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyati  saḥ etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśati
translated: He who knows this immortal [element] thus, becomes one of the Maruts, and by means of Soma as his mouth, he is satisfied by seeing this very immortal [element].🔽He enters into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udeti
translated: From this form he rises up.

original: sa yāvad ādityaḥ paścād udetā purastād astam etā dvis tāvad uttarata udetā dakṣiṇato 'stam etā marutām eva tāvad ādhipatyaṃ svārājyaṃ paryetā
analyzed: sa yāvat ādityaḥ paścāt udetā purastāt astam etāḥ dvis tāvat uttaratas udetā dakṣiṇatas stam etāḥ marutām eva tāvat ādhipatyam svārājyam paryetā
translated: As long as the sun rises in the west and sets in the east, twice as long it rises in the north and sets in the south. He attains the overlordship and sovereignty of the Maruts to that extent.

analyzed: te etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti

translated: He who knows that immortal element thus, becoming one with the Sadhyas, with Brahman as his mouth, is satisfied merely by seeing that immortal element.

analyzed: saḥ etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśati
translated: He enters into that very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udeti
translated: He rises from that form.

original: sa yāvad āditya uttarata udetā dakṣiṇato 'stam etā dvis tāvad ūrdhvam udetārvāg astam etā sādhyānām eva tāvad ādhipatyaṃ svārājyaṃ paryetā
analyzed: sa yāvat ādityaḥ uttaratas udetā dakṣiṇatas stam etāḥ dvis tāvat ūrdhvam udetā arvāk astam etā sādhyānām eva tāvat ādhipatyam svārājyam paryetā
translated: As long as the sun rises in the north and sets in the south, twice as long it rises upwards and sets downwards. He attains the overlordship and sovereignty of the Sadhyas to that extent.

original: atha tata ūrdhva udetya naivodetā nāstam etaikala eva madhye sthātā /
analyzed: atha tatas ūrdhvaḥ udetya na eva udetā na astam etā ekalaḥ eva madhye sthātā
translated: Then rising up from there, it would neither rise nor set, but would stand alone in the middle.

original: tad eṣa ślokaḥ // / / //🔽na vai tatra na nimloca /
analyzed: tat eṣa ślokaḥ  na vai tatra na nimloca
translated: This is the verse about it...🔽It does not set there,

analyzed: na udiyāya kadācana
translated: nor does it rise at any time.

analyzed: devāḥ tena aham satyena
translated: By that truth, O gods,

analyzed: mā virādhiṣi brahmaṇā iti
translated: may I not be harmed by Brahman...

original: na ha vā asmā udeti na nimlocati /
analyzed: na ha vai asmai udeti na nimlocati

analyzed: sakṛt divā ha eva asmai bhavati

analyzed: yaḥ etām evam brahma upaniṣadam veda

analyzed: tat ha etat uddālakāya aruṇaye jyeṣṭhāya putrāya pitā brahma provāca
translated: That Brahman was told by the father to Uddalaka Aruni, his eldest son...

original: idaṃ vāva taj jyeṣṭhāya putrāya pitā brahma prabrūyāt praṇāyyāya vāntevāsine // / / //
analyzed: idam vāva tat jyeṣṭhāya putrāya pitā brahma prabrūyāt praṇāyyāya vā antevāsine
translated: A father should tell this Brahman to his eldest son, or to his grandson, or to a pupil who lives with him,

analyzed: na anyasmai kasmaicana
translated: not to anyone else.

analyzed: yadi api asmai imām adbhiḥ parigṛhītām dhanasya pūrṇām dadyāt etat eva tatas bhūyaḥ iti
translated: Even if one were to give him this world filled with water and wealth, it would be more than that...

original: gāyatrī vā idaṃ sarvaṃ bhūtaṃ yad idam kiñca /
analyzed: gāyatrī vai idam sarvam bhūtam yat idam kiñca
translated: This entire world, whatever there is, is indeed Gayatri.

analyzed: vāc vai gāyatrī
translated: Speech is indeed Gayatri.

original: vāg vā idaṃ sarvaṃ bhūtaṃ gāyati ca trāyate ca // / / //
analyzed: vāc vai idam sarvam bhūtam gāyati ca trāyate ca
translated: Speech, verily, sings this whole world and protects it.

original: yā vai sā gāyatrīyaṃ vāva sā yeyaṃ pṛthivī /
analyzed: yā vai sā gāyatrī iyam vāva sā yā iyam pṛthivī
translated: That which is the Gāyatrī, verily, it is this earth.

analyzed: asyām hi idam sarvam bhūtam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: For on this earth all this world is established.

analyzed: etām eva na atiśīyate
translated: One does not go beyond it.

original: yā vai sā pṛthivīyaṃ vāva sā yad idam asmin puruṣe śarīram /
analyzed: yā vai sā pṛthivī iyam vāva sā yat idam asmin puruṣe śarīram
translated: That which is the earth, verily, it is this which is the body in this man.

analyzed: asmin hi ime prāṇāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: For in this the vital breaths are established.

analyzed: etat eva na atiśīyante
translated: One does not go beyond it.

original: yad vai tat puruṣe śarīram idaṃ vāva tad yad idam asminn antaḥ puruṣe hṛdayam /
analyzed: yat vai tat puruṣe śarīram idam vāva tat yat idam asmin antar puruṣe hṛdayam
translated: That which is the body in the man, verily, it is this which is the heart in this man within.

analyzed: asmin hi ime prāṇāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: For in this the vital breaths are established.

analyzed: etat eva na atiśīyante
translated: One does not go beyond it.

analyzed: sā eṣā catuṣpadā ṣaḍvidhā gāyatrī
translated: This is the four-footed, six-fold Gāyatrī.

analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyanūktam
translated: This has been said in the Ṛc:

original: tāvān asya mahimā tato jyāyāṃś ca puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: tāvān asya mahimā tatas jyāyān ca puruṣaḥ
translated: So great is its greatness, and greater than that is the Person.

translated: A foot of it are all beings, three feet of it is the immortal in heaven.🔽That which is Brahman, verily, it is this which is the space outside the man.

original: yo vai sa bahirdhā puruṣād ākāśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ vai sa bahirdhā puruṣāt ākāśaḥ
translated: That which is the space outside the man,🔽.

original: ayaṃ vāva sa yo 'yam antaḥ puruṣa ākāśaḥ /🔽yo vai so 'ntaḥ puruṣa ākāśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ayam vāva sa yaḥ yam antar puruṣaḥ ākāśaḥ  yaḥ vai saḥ ntar puruṣaḥ ākāśaḥ
translated: This indeed is that which is the space within the person.🔽This which is the space within the person...

original: ayaṃ vāva sa yo 'yam antarhṛdaya ākāśaḥ /
analyzed: ayam vāva sa yaḥ yam antar hṛdaye ākāśaḥ
translated: This indeed is that which is the space within the heart.

analyzed: tat etat pūrṇam a pravarti

original: pūrṇam apravartinīṃ śriyaṃ labhate ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: pūrṇam a pravartinīm śriyam labhate yaḥ evam veda

analyzed: saḥ ādityaḥ

analyzed: tat etat tejaḥ nnādyam iti upāsīta

original: tejasvy annādo bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: tejasvī anna ādaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda

analyzed: sa candramāḥ

translated: One should worship that as glory and fame.

original: śrīmān yaśasvī bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: śrīmān yaśasvī bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: One becomes glorious and famous who knows thus.

analyzed: atha yaḥ sya pratyaṅ suṣiḥ saḥ pānaḥ
translated: Now that which is his western opening is the in-breath.

analyzed: sā vāc

analyzed: saḥ gniḥ

analyzed: tat etat brahmavarcasam annādyam iti upāsīta
translated: One should worship that as brahmic glory and food.

analyzed: brahmavarcasī anna ādaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: One becomes radiant and an eater of food who knows thus.

analyzed: atha yaḥ sya udaṅ suṣiḥ sa samānaḥ
translated: Now, that upper opening of his is the equalizing breath.

analyzed: tat manaḥ

analyzed: sa parjanyaḥ
translated: That is Parjanya.

original: tad etat kīrtiś ca vyuṣṭiś cetyupāsīta /
analyzed: tat etat kīrtiḥ ca vyuṣṭiḥ ca iti upāsīta
translated: One should worship that as fame and prosperity.

original: kīrtimān vyuṣṭimān bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: kīrtimān vyuṣṭimān bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: One becomes famous and prosperous who knows this thus.

analyzed: atha yaḥ sya ūrdhvaḥ suṣiḥ saḥ udānaḥ
translated: Now, that upper opening of his is the upward breath.

analyzed: sa vāyuḥ
translated: That is the wind.

analyzed: saḥ ākāśaḥ
translated: That is space.

original: tad etad ojaś ca mahaś cety upāsīta /
analyzed: tat etat ojaḥ ca mahaḥ ca iti upāsīta
translated: One should worship that as strength and greatness.

original: ojasvī mahasvān bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: ojasvī mahasvān bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: One becomes strong and great who knows this thus.

original: te vā ete pañca brahmapuruṣāḥ svargasya lokasya dvārapāḥ /
analyzed: te vai ete pañca brahma puruṣāḥ svargasya lokasya dvārapāḥ
translated: These, then, are the five Brahmic persons, the doorkeepers of the world of heaven.

original: sa ya etān evaṃ pañca brahmapuruṣān svargasya lokasya dvārapān vedāsya kule vīro jāyate /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etān evam pañca brahma puruṣān svargasya lokasya dvārapān veda asya kule vīraḥ jāyate
translated: To one who knows these five Brahmic persons as the doorkeepers of the world of heaven, a hero is born in his family.

original: pratipadyate svargaṃ lokaṃ ya etān evaṃ pañca brahmapuruṣān svargasya lokasya dvārapān veda // / / //
analyzed: pratipadyate svargam lokam yaḥ etān evam pañca brahma puruṣān svargasya lokasya dvārapān veda
translated: He attains the world of heaven who knows these five Brahmic persons as the doorkeepers of the world of heaven.

original: atha yad ataḥ paro divo jyotir dīpyate viśvataḥpṛṣṭheṣu sarvataḥpṛṣṭheṣv anuttameṣūttameṣu lokeṣv idaṃ vāva tad yad idam asminn antaḥ puruṣe 🔽jyotiḥ /
analyzed: atha yat atas paras divaḥ jyotiḥ dīpyate viśvatas pṛṣṭheṣu sarvatas pṛṣṭheṣu anuttameṣu uttameṣu lokeṣu idam vāva tat yat idam asmin antar puruṣe  /🔽jyotiḥ
translated: Now, that light which shines beyond this heaven, on all sides, on the unsurpassed, highest worlds, that is this, that is the light in this person here.

original: tasyaiṣā dṛṣṭir yatraitad asmiñ charīre saṃsparśenoṣṇimānaṃ vijānāti /
analyzed: tasya eṣā dṛṣṭiḥ yatra etat asmin śarīre saṃsparśena uṣṇimānam vijānāti
translated: This is his sight, where one perceives heat by touch in this body.

original: tasyaiṣā śrutir yatraitat karṇāv apigṛhya ninadam iva nadathur ivāgner iva jvalata upaśṛnoti /
analyzed: tasya eṣā śrutiḥ yatra etat karṇau apigṛhya ninadam iva nadathuḥ iva agneḥ iva jvalataḥ upaśṛnoti
translated: This is his hearing, where, having grasped the ears, one hears as if a roaring, a thundering, like the burning of a fire.

original: tad etad dṛṣṭaṃ ca śrutaṃ cety upāsīta /
analyzed: tat etat dṛṣṭam ca śrutam ca iti upāsīta
translated: One should worship this as seen and heard.

original: cakṣuṣyaḥ śruto bhavati ya evaṃ veda ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: cakṣuṣyaḥ śrutaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda yaḥ evam veda
translated: One becomes one whose eyes are good and one whose ears are good, one who knows this, one who knows this.

original: sarvaṃ khalv idaṃ brahma tajjalān iti śānta upāsīta /
analyzed: sarvam khalu idam brahma tat jalān iti śāntaḥ upāsīta
translated: All this, verily, is Brahman. It is born of water. One should worship it as tranquil.

original: atha khalu kratumayaḥ puruṣo yathākratur asmiṃl loke puruṣo bhavati tathetaḥ pretya bhavati /
analyzed: atha khalu kratu mayaḥ puruṣaḥ yathā kratuḥ asmin loke puruṣaḥ bhavati tathā itas pretya bhavati
translated: Now, verily, a person is made of thought. As is his thought in this world, so does he become when he departs from here.

analyzed: sa kratum kurvīta
translated: He should make his thought thus.

original: manomayaḥ prāṇaśarīro bhārūpaḥ satyasaṃkalpa ākāśātmā sarvakarmā sarvakāmaḥ sarvagandhaḥ sarvarasaḥ sarvam idam abhyatto 'vāky anādaraḥ //
analyzed: manaḥ mayaḥ prāṇa śarīraḥ bhā rūpaḥ satya saṃkalpaḥ ākāśa ātmā sarva karmā sarva kāmaḥ sarva gandhaḥ sarva rasaḥ sarvam idam abhyattaḥ vākī anādaraḥ
translated: He is made of mind, his body is breath, he is of the form of light, his resolve is truth, his self is space, he is all action, he is all desire, he is all smell, he is all taste, he has entered all this, he is without speech, he is without regard.

original: eṣa ma ātmā antarhṛdaye 'ṇīyān vrīher vā yavād vā sarṣapād vā śyāmākād vā śyāmākataṇḍulād vā /
analyzed: eṣa me ātmā antar hṛdaye ṇīyān vrīheḥ vā yavāt vā sarṣapāt vā śyāmākāt vā śyāmāka taṇḍulāt vā
translated: This is my self within the heart, smaller than a corn of rice, smaller than a corn of barley, smaller than a corn of mustard, smaller than a grain of millet.

original: eṣa ma ātmā antarhṛdaye jyāyān pṛthivyā jyāyān antarikṣāj jyāyān divo jyāyān ebhyo lokebhyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: eṣa me ātmā antar hṛdaye jyāyān pṛthivyāḥ jyāyān antarikṣāt jyāyān divaḥ jyāyān ebhyaḥ lokebhyaḥ
translated: This Self of mine which is within the heart, is greater than the earth, greater than the atmosphere, greater than the sky, greater than these worlds.

original: sarvakarmā sarvakāmaḥ sarvagandhaḥ sarvarasaḥ sarvam idam abhyatto 'vākyanādaraḥ /
analyzed: sarva karmā sarva kāmaḥ sarva gandhaḥ sarva rasaḥ sarvam idam abhyattaḥ vākya anādaraḥ
translated: He is all action, all desire, all smell, all taste, all this is encompassed by him, he is the unutterable, the unignored.

analyzed: eṣa me ātmā antar hṛdaye
translated: This is my Self which is within the heart.

analyzed: etat brahma
translated: This is Brahman.

original: etam itaḥ pretyābhisaṃbhavitā asmīti yasya syād addhā na vicikitsā asti /
analyzed: etam itas pretya abhisaṃbhavitā asmi iti yasya syāt addhā na vicikitsā asti
translated: He who has this thought, 'I shall become united with this after death,' verily, he has no doubt.

analyzed: iti ha sma āha śāṇḍilyaḥ śāṇḍilyaḥ
translated: Thus indeed did Śāṇḍilya say. Śāṇḍilya said.

analyzed: antarikṣa udaraḥ kośaḥ bhūmi budhnaḥ na jīryati
translated: The womb whose belly is the atmosphere, whose bottom is the earth, does not decay.

original: diśo hy asya sraktayo dyaur asyottaraṃ bilam /
analyzed: diśaḥ hi asya sraktayaḥ dyauḥ asya uttaram bilam
translated: For its corners are the quarters, its upper opening is the sky.

original: sa eṣa kośo vasudhānas tasmin viśvam idaṃ śritam // / / //
analyzed: saḥ eṣa kośaḥ vasu dhānaḥ tasmin viśvam idam śritam
translated: That womb is the abode of wealth, in it all this is established.

analyzed: tasya prācī diś juhūḥ nāma
translated: Of it, the eastern quarter is named Juhū.

analyzed: sahamānā nāma dakṣiṇā
translated: The southern quarter is named Sahāmanā.

analyzed: rājñī nāma pratīcī
translated: The western quarter is named Rājñī.

analyzed: subhūtā nāma udīcī
translated: The northern quarter is named Subhūtā.

analyzed: tāsām vāyuḥ vatsaḥ
translated: Of them, the wind is the calf.

original: sa ya etam evaṃ vāyuṃ diśāṃ vatsaṃ veda na putrarodaṃ roditi /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam vāyum diśām vatsam veda na putra rodam roditi
translated: He who knows the wind thus as the calf of the quarters, does not weep for his son.

original: so 'ham etam evaṃ vāyuṃ diśāṃ vatsaṃ veda /
analyzed: saḥ ham etam evam vāyum diśām vatsam veda
translated: I know the wind thus as the calf of the quarters.

analyzed: mā putra rodam rudam  ariṣṭam kośam prapadye munā amunā amunā
translated: Do not weep, O son's weeping.🔽I resort to the safe womb with this, with this, with this.

analyzed: prāṇam prapadye munā amunā amunā  bhūḥ prapadye munā amunā amunā  bhuvaḥ prapadye munā amunā amunā
translated: I resort to the life force with this, with this, with this.🔽I resort to the earth with this, with this, with this.🔽I resort to the atmosphere with this, with this, with this.

analyzed: svar prapadye munā amunā amunā
translated: I resort to heaven with this, with this, with this.

original: sa yad avocaṃ prāṇaṃ prapadya iti /
analyzed: sa yat avocam prāṇam prapadye iti
translated: When I said, I resort to the life force,

original: prāno vā idaṃ sarvaṃ bhūtaṃ yad idaṃ kiṃca /
analyzed: prānas vai idam sarvam bhūtam yat idam kiṃca
translated: the life force is indeed all this that exists, whatever there is.

analyzed: tam eva tat prāpatsi
translated: By that, you have attained it.

original: atha yad avocaṃ bhuvaḥ prapadya ity agniṃ prapadye vāyuṃ prapadya ādityaṃ prapadya ity eva tad avocam // / / //
analyzed: atha yat avocam bhuvaḥ prapadye iti agnim prapadye vāyum prapadye ādityam prapadye iti eva tat avocam
translated: Then when I said, I resort to the earth, I meant, I resort to Agni, I resort to Vayu, I resort to Aditya.

original: atha yad avocaṃ svaḥ prapadya ity ṛgvedaṃ prapadye yajurvedaṃ prapadye sāmavedaṃ prapadya ity eva tad avocam // / / //
analyzed: atha yat avocam svar prapadye iti ṛgvedam prapadye yajurvedam prapadye sāmavedam prapadye iti eva tat avocam
translated: Then when I said, I resort to heaven, I meant, I resort to the Rig Veda, I resort to the Yajur Veda, I resort to the Sama Veda.

analyzed: puruṣaḥ vāva yajñaḥ
translated: Verily, man is the sacrifice.

analyzed: tasya yāni caturviṃśati varṣāṇi tat prātaḥsavanam
translated: Of him, the twenty-four years are the morning pressing.

analyzed: caturviṃśati akṣarā gāyatrī
translated: The Gayatri has twenty-four syllables.

analyzed: gāyatram prātaḥsavanam
translated: The morning pressing is based on the Gayatri.

analyzed: tat asya vasavaḥ nu āyattāḥ
translated: The Vasus are connected with that.

analyzed: prāṇāḥ vāva vasavaḥ
translated: The life breaths are indeed the Vasus.

analyzed: ete hi idam sarvam vāsayanti
translated: For these indeed make all this breathe.

original: taṃ ced etasmin vayasi kiṃcid upatapet sa brūyāt /
analyzed: tam ced etasmin vayasi kiṃcid upatapet sa brūyāt
translated: If anything should afflict him in this stage of life, he should say:

original: prāṇā vasava idaṃ me prātaḥsavanaṃ mādhyaṃdinaṃ savanam anusaṃtanuteti māhaṃ prāṇānāṃ vasūnāṃ madhye yajño vilopsīyeti /
analyzed: prāṇāḥ vasavaḥ idam me prātaḥsavanam mādhyaṃdinam savanam anusaṃtanuta iti mā aham prāṇānām vasūnām madhye yajñaḥ
translated: 'The vital breaths, the Vasus, continue for me this morning pressing, the midday pressing, lest I, the sacrifice, should be lost among the vital breaths, the Vasus.'

original: ud dhaiva tata ety agado ha bhavati // / / //
analyzed: ud ha eva tatas eti agadaḥ ha bhavati
translated: Rising up from there, he becomes free from disease.

original: atha yāni catuścatvāriṃśad varṣāṇi tan mādhyaṃdinaṃ savanam /
analyzed: atha yāni catuścatvāriṃśat varṣāṇi tat mādhyaṃdinam savanam
translated: Now the forty-four years are the midday pressing.

analyzed: catuścatvāriṃśat akṣarā triṣṭubh
translated: The Tristubh has forty-four syllables.

analyzed: traiṣṭubham mādhyaṃdinam savanam
translated: The midday pressing belongs to the Tristubh.

analyzed: tat asya rudrāḥ anvāyattāḥ
translated: The Rudras are connected with that.

analyzed: prāṇāḥ vāva rudrāḥ
translated: The vital breaths are indeed the Rudras.

analyzed: ete hi idam sarvam rodayanti
translated: For these indeed make all this weep.

original: taṃ ced etasmin vayasi kiṃcid upatapet sa brūyāt /
analyzed: tam ced etasmin vayasi kiṃcid upatapet sa brūyāt
translated: If anything should afflict him in this stage of life, he should say:

original: prāṇā rudrā idaṃ me mādhyaṃdinaṃ savanaṃ tṛtīyasavanam anusaṃtanuteti māhaṃ prāṇānāṃ rudrāṇāṃ madhye yajño vilopsīyeti /
analyzed: prāṇāḥ rudrāḥ idam me mādhyaṃdinam savanam tṛtīyasavanam anusaṃtanuta iti mā aham prāṇānām rudrāṇām madhye yajñaḥ
translated: 'The vital breaths, the Rudras, continue for me this midday pressing, the third pressing, lest I, the sacrifice, should be lost among the vital breaths, the Rudras.'

original: ud dhaiva tata ety agado ha bhavati // / / //
analyzed: ud ha eva tatas eti agadaḥ ha bhavati
translated: Rising up from there, he becomes free from disease.

original: atha yāny aṣṭācatvāriṃśad varṣāṇi tat tṛtīyasavanam /
analyzed: atha yāni aṣṭācatvāriṃśat varṣāṇi tat tṛtīyasavanam
translated: Now, the forty-eight years, that is the third pressing.

analyzed: aṣṭācatvāriṃśat akṣarā jagatī
translated: The Jagati has forty-eight syllables.

analyzed: jāgatam tṛtīyasavanam
translated: The third pressing is connected with the Jagati.

analyzed: tat asya ādityāḥ anvāyattāḥ
translated: The Adityas are connected with that.

analyzed: prāṇāḥ vāva ādityāḥ
translated: The Adityas are the vital airs.

analyzed: ete hi idam sarvam ādadate
translated: For they take away everything here.

original: taṃ ced etasmin vayasi kiṃcid upatapet sa brūyāt /
analyzed: tam ced etasmin vayasi kiṃcid upatapet sa brūyāt
translated: If anything should afflict him in that age, he should say:

original: prāṇā ādityā idaṃ me tṛtīyasavanam āyur anusaṃtanuteti māhaṃ prāṇānām ādityānāṃ madhye yajño vilopsīyeti /
analyzed: prāṇāḥ ādityāḥ idam me tṛtīyasavanam āyuḥ anusaṃtanuta iti mā aham prāṇānām ādityānām madhye yajñaḥ
translated: 'The vital airs, the Adityas, extend my life, this third pressing of mine, lest I should be lost as a sacrifice among the vital airs, the Adityas.'

original: ud dhaiva tata ety agado haiva bhavati // / / //
analyzed: ud ha eva tatas eti agadaḥ ha eva bhavati
translated: He should rise up from there, and he will be free from disease.

original: etad dha sma vai tad vidvān āha mahidāsa aitareyaḥ /
analyzed: etat ha sma vai tat vidvān āha mahidāsa aitareyaḥ
translated: Now, indeed, he who knew this said that Mahi-dasAitareya.

original: sa kiṃ ma etad upatapasi yo 'ham anena na preṣyām iti /
analyzed: sa kim me etat upatapasi yaḥ ham anena na iti
translated: 'What do you afflict me with, since I shall not send you away with this?'

analyzed: sa ha ṣoḍaśam varṣa śatam ajīvat
translated: He lived for one hundred and sixteen years.

original: pra ha ṣoḍaśaṃ varṣaśataṃ jīvati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: pra ha ṣoḍaśam varṣa śatam jīvati yaḥ evam veda
translated: One lives for one hundred and sixteen years who knows this.

original: sa yad aśiśiṣati yat pipāsati yan na ramate tā asya dīkṣāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa yat aśiśiṣati yat pipāsati yat na ramate tāḥ asya dīkṣāḥ
translated: Whatever he does not eat, whatever he does not drink, whatever he does not enjoy, those are his consecrations.

original: atha yad aśnāti yat pibati yad ramate tad upasadair eti // / / //
analyzed: atha yat aśnāti yat pibati yat ramate tat upasadaiḥ eti
translated: Now, whatever he eats, whatever he drinks, whatever he enjoys, that he approaches with the Upasads.

original: atha yad dhasati yaj jakṣati yan maithunaṃ carati stutaśastrair eva tad eti // / / //
analyzed: atha yat hasati yat jakṣati yat maithunam carati stuta śastraiḥ eva tat eti
translated: Now, whatever he laughs at, whatever he eats, whatever sexual intercourse he has, that he approaches with the Stomas and Sastras.

original: atha yat tapo dānam ārjavam ahiṃsā satyavacanam iti tā asya dakṣiṇāḥ // / / //
analyzed: atha yat tapaḥ dānam ārjavam ahiṃsā satya vacanam iti tāḥ asya dakṣiṇāḥ
translated: Now, austerity, charity, uprightness, non-violence, and speaking the truth, these are his sacrificial fees.

analyzed: tasmāt āhuḥ soṣyati
translated: Therefore they say, He will beget, He has begotten.

analyzed: punar utpādanam eva asya tat
translated: That is his rebirth.

analyzed: maraṇam eva avabhṛthaḥ
translated: Death itself is the final bath.

original: tad dhaitad ghora āṅgirasaḥ kṛṣṇāya devakīputrāyoktvovāca /
analyzed: tat ha etat ghoraḥ āṅgirasaḥ kṛṣṇāya devakīputrāya uktvā uvāca
translated: That was said by Ghora Angirasa to Krishna, the son of Devaki, and he said:

analyzed: apipāsaḥ eva sa babhūva
translated: He became free from thirst.

original: so 'ntavelāyām etat trayaṃ pratipadyetākṣitam asy acyutam asi prāṇasaṃśitam asīti /
analyzed: saḥ etat trayam pratipadyeta akṣitam asi acyutam asi prāṇa saṃśitam asi iti
translated: At the time of death, one should adopt these three: You are the unseen, You are the unfallen, You are sharpened by the vital breath.

analyzed: tatra ete dve ṛcau bhavataḥ
translated: There are these two verses about that.

analyzed: ādit pratnasya retasaḥ
translated: From the beginning of the seed,

analyzed: ud vayam tamasaspari
translated: we rise above the darkness,

analyzed: jyotiḥ paśyantaḥ uttaram
translated: seeing the light above,

analyzed: svar paśyantaḥ uttaram
translated: seeing the heaven above.

original: devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam iti jyotir uttamam iti // / / //
analyzed: devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam iti jyotiḥ uttamam iti
translated: We have gone to the god, the sun, the light above, the highest light.

analyzed: manaḥ brahma iti upāsīta
translated: One should meditate on the mind as Brahman.

analyzed: iti adhyātmam
translated: Thus it is in the self.

analyzed: atha adhidaivatam
translated: Now in the gods.

analyzed: ākāśaḥ brahma
translated: Brahma is space.

original: ity ubhayam ādiṣṭaṃ bhavaty adhyātmaṃ cādhidaivataṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: iti ubhayam ādiṣṭam bhavati adhyātmam ca adhidaivatam ca
translated: Thus both are taught, in the self and in the gods.

analyzed: tat etat catuṣpād brahma
translated: This Brahma has four feet.

original: vāk pādaḥ prāṇaḥ pādaś cakṣuḥ pādaḥ śrotraṃ pādaḥ /
analyzed: vāc pādaḥ prāṇaḥ pādaḥ cakṣuḥ pādaḥ śrotram pādaḥ
translated: Speech is one foot, life-breath is one foot, the eye is one foot, the ear is one foot.

analyzed: iti adhyātmam
translated: Thus it is in the self.

analyzed: atha adhidaivatam
translated: Now in the gods.

original: agniḥ pādo vāyuḥ pāda ādityaḥ pādo diśaḥ pādaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ pādaḥ vāyuḥ pādaḥ ādityaḥ pādaḥ diśaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Fire is one foot, wind is one foot, sun is one foot, the directions are one foot.

original: ity ubhayam evādiṣṭaṃ bhavaty adhyātmaṃ cādhidaivataṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: iti ubhayam eva ādiṣṭam bhavati adhyātmam ca adhidaivatam ca
translated: Thus both are taught, in the self and in the gods.

analyzed: vāc eva brahmaṇaḥ caturthaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Speech alone is the fourth foot of Brahma.

original: so 'gninā jyotiṣā bhāti ca tapati ca /
analyzed: saḥ gninā jyotiṣā bhāti ca tapati ca
translated: It shines and warms with fire as its light.

original: bhāti ca tapati ca kīrtyā yaśasā brahmavarcasena ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: bhāti ca tapati ca kīrtyā yaśasā brahmavarcasena yaḥ evam veda
translated: One who knows this shines and warms with fame, glory, and spiritual radiance.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ eva brahmaṇaḥ caturthaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Life-breath alone is the fourth foot of Brahma.

original: sa vāyunā jyotiṣā bhāti ca tapati ca /
analyzed: sa vāyunā jyotiṣā bhāti ca tapati ca
translated: It shines and warms with wind as its light.

original: bhāti ca tapati ca kīrtyā yaśasā brahmavarcasena ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: bhāti ca tapati ca kīrtyā yaśasā brahmavarcasena yaḥ evam veda
translated: One who knows this shines and warms with fame, glory, and spiritual radiance.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ eva brahmaṇaḥ caturthaḥ pādaḥ
translated: The eye alone is the fourth foot of Brahma.

original: sa ādityena jyotiṣā bhāti ca tapati ca /
analyzed: saḥ ādityena jyotiṣā bhāti ca tapati ca
translated: It shines and warms with the sun as its light.

original: bhāti ca tapati ca kīrtyā yaśasā brahmavarcasena ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: bhāti ca tapati ca kīrtyā yaśasā brahmavarcasena yaḥ evam veda
translated: He shines and warms with fame, glory, and spiritual power who knows this.

analyzed: śrotram eva brahmaṇaḥ caturthaḥ pādaḥ
translated: The ear indeed is the fourth foot of Brahman.

original: sa digbhir jyotiṣā bhāti ca tapati ca /
analyzed: sa digbhiḥ jyotiṣā bhāti ca tapati ca
translated: It shines and warms with the directions and the luminaries.

original: bhāti ca tapati ca kīrtyā yaśasā brahmavarcasena ya evaṃ veda ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: bhāti ca tapati ca kīrtyā yaśasā brahmavarcasena yaḥ evam veda yaḥ evam veda
translated: He shines and warms with fame, glory, and spiritual power who knows this.

analyzed: ādityaḥ brahma iti ādeśaḥ
translated: The teaching is that the sun is Brahman.

analyzed: tasya upavyākhyānam
translated: Its explanation is as follows:

original: asad evedam agra āsīt /🔽tat sad āsīt /
analyzed: asat eva idam agre āsīt  tat sat āsīt
translated: This universe was non-existent in the beginning.🔽It became existent.

analyzed: tat samabhavat  tat āṇḍam niravartata
translated: It came into being.🔽That became an egg.

analyzed: tat saṃvatsarasya mātrām aśayata
translated: It lay for the duration of a year.

analyzed: tat nirabhidyata
translated: It split open.

original: te āṇḍakapāle rajataṃ ca suvarṇaṃ cābhavatām // / / //
analyzed: te āṇḍa kapāle rajatam ca suvarṇam ca abhavatām
translated: From the egg-shells silver and gold came to be.

analyzed: tat yat rajatam sā iyam pṛthivī
translated: That which was silver became this earth.

original: yat suvarṇaṃ sā dyauḥ /🔽yaj jarāyu te parvatāḥ /
analyzed: yat suvarṇam sā dyauḥ  yat jarāyu te parvatāḥ
translated: That which was gold became the sky.

original: yad ulbaṃ sa🔽samegho nīhāraḥ /🔽yā dhamanayas tā nadyaḥ /
analyzed: yat ulbam sa  sa meghaḥ nīhāraḥ  yāḥ dhamanayaḥ tāḥ nadyaḥ
translated: That which was the outer membrane became the mountains.🔽That which was the inner membrane became the clouds.🔽The veins became the rivers.🔽The water in the womb became the ocean.

original: yad vāsteyam udakaṃ sa samudraḥ // / / //🔽atha yat tad ajāyata so 'sāv ādityaḥ /
analyzed: yat vāsteyam udakam sa samudraḥ 🔽atha yat tat ajāyata saḥ sau ādityaḥ
translated: And that which was born is this sun.

original: taṃ jāyamānaṃ ghoṣā ulūlavo 'nūdatiṣṭhant sarvāṇi ca bhūtāni sarve ca kāmāḥ /
analyzed: tam jāyamānam ghoṣāḥ ulūlavaḥ nu udatiṣṭhan sarvāṇi ca bhūtāni sarve ca kāmāḥ
translated: When he was born, the sounds, the ulūlas, and all beings and all desires stood up after him.

original: tasmāt tasyodayaṃ prati pratyāyanaṃ prati ghoṣā ulūlavo 'nūttiṣṭhanti sarvāṇi ca bhūtāni sarve ca kāmāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt tasya udayam prati pratyāyanam prati ghoṣāḥ ulūlavaḥ nu uttiṣṭhanti sarvāṇi ca bhūtāni sarve ca kāmāḥ
translated: Therefore, towards his rising and setting, the sounds, the ulūlas, and all beings and all desires stand up after him.

original: sa ya etam evaṃ vidvān ādityaṃ brahmety upāste /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam vidvān ādityam brahma iti upāste
translated: He who, knowing thus, worships the sun as Brahman,

original: abhyāśo ha yad enaṃ sādhavo ghoṣā ā ca gaccheyur upa ca nimreḍeran nimreḍeran // / / //
analyzed: abhyāśaḥ ha yat enam sādhavaḥ ghoṣāḥ ā ca gaccheyuḥ upa ca nimreḍeran nimreḍeran
translated: it is certain that good sounds would come to him and be attached to him.

original: jānaśrutir ha pautrāyaṇaḥ śraddhādeyo bahudāyī bahupākya āsa /
analyzed: jānaśrutiḥ ha pautrāyaṇaḥ śraddhā deyaḥ bahu dāyī bahu pākyaḥ āsa
translated: Jānaśruti's grandson, Pautrāyaṇa, was one who gave out of faith, who gave much, who cooked much.

original: sa ha sarvata āvasathān māpayāṃ cakre sarvata eva me 'nnam atsyantīti // / / //
analyzed: sa ha sarvatas āvasathāt mā apayām cakre sarvatas eva me nnam atsyanti iti
translated: He had houses built all around, thinking, From everywhere they will eat my food.

analyzed: atha ha haṃsāḥ niśāyām atipetuḥ
translated: Then, at night, geese flew over.

analyzed: tat ha evam haṃsaḥ haṃsam abhyuvāda
translated: Then a goose called out to another goose:

original: ho ho 'yi bhallākṣa bhallākṣa jānaśruteḥ pautrāyaṇasya samaṃ divā jyotir ātataṃ tan mā prasāṅkṣīs tat tvāṃ mā pradhākṣīr iti // / /
analyzed: ho ho yi bhallākṣa bhallākṣa jānaśruteḥ pautrāyaṇasya samam divā jyotiḥ ātatam tat mā prasāṅkṣīḥ tat tvām mā pradhākṣīḥ iti
translated: Ho! Ho! O Bhallāksha! O Bhallāksha! The light of Jānaśruti's grandson, Pautrāyaṇa, is spread out evenly during the day. Don't touch it! Don't burn yourself!

original: tam u ha paraḥ pratyuvāca kam v ara enam etat santaṃ sayugvānam iva raikvam āttha iti /
analyzed: tam u ha paraḥ pratyuvāca kam u are enam etat santam sayugvānam iva raikvam āttha iti
translated: The other one replied to him: 'You have spoken of him as if he were a Rāikva with a yoke-fellow, though he is a mere nobody.'

original: yo nu kathaṃ sayugvā raikva iti // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ nu katham sayugvā raikvaḥ iti
translated: 'But how is Rāikva a yoke-fellow?'

original: yathā kṛtāya vijitāyādhareyāḥ saṃyanty evam enaṃ sarvaṃ tad abhisameti yat kiṃca prajāḥ sādhu kurvanti /
analyzed: yathā kṛtāya vijitāya adhareyāḥ saṃyanti evam enam sarvam tat abhisameti yat kiṃca prajāḥ sādhu kurvanti
translated: 'Just as all the conquered and won people come to him, so all that the people do well comes to him.

original: yas tad veda yat sa veda sa mayaitad ukta iti // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ tat veda yat sa veda sa mayā etat uktaḥ iti
translated: He who knows that, he who knows him, he is the one I have spoken of.'

original: tad u ha jānaśrutiḥ pautrāyaṇa upaśuśrāva /
analyzed: tat u ha jānaśrutiḥ pautrāyaṇaḥ upaśuśrāva
translated: Now Jānaśruti's grandson heard this.

original: sa ha saṃjihāna eva kṣattāram uvācāṅgāre ha sayugvānam iva raikvam āttheti /
analyzed: sa ha saṃjihānaḥ eva kṣattāram uvāca aṅgāre ha sayugvānam iva raikvam āttha iti
translated: While he was yawning, he said to the doorkeeper: 'You have spoken of Rāikva as if he were a Rāikva with a yoke-fellow, with a piece of charcoal.'

original: yo nu kathaṃ sayugvā raikva iti // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ nu katham sayugvā raikvaḥ iti
translated: 'But how is Rāikva a yoke-fellow?'

original: yathā kṛtāya vijitāyādhareyāḥ saṃyanty evam enaṃ sarvaṃ tad abhisameti yat kiṃca prajāḥ sādhu kurvanti /
analyzed: yathā kṛtāya vijitāya adhareyāḥ saṃyanti evam enam sarvam tat abhisameti yat kiṃca prajāḥ sādhu kurvanti
translated: 'Just as all the conquered and won people come to him, so all that the people do well comes to him.

original: yas tad veda yat sa veda sa mayaitad ukta iti // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ tat veda yat sa veda sa mayā etat uktaḥ iti
translated: He who knows that, he who knows him, he is the one I have spoken of.'

original: sa ha kṣattānviṣya nāvidam iti pratyeyāya /
analyzed: sa ha kṣattā anviṣya na avidam iti pratyeyāya
translated: The doorkeeper searched for him and returned, saying: 'I have not found him.'

original: taṃ hovāca yatrāre brāhmaṇasyānveṣaṇā tad enam arccheti // / / //
analyzed: tam ha uvāca yatra are brāhmaṇasya anveṣaṇā tat enam
translated: He said to him, 'Where the search of the Brâhmana ends, there he should reach.'

analyzed: saḥ dhastāt śakaṭasya pāmānam kaṣamāṇam upopaviveśa
translated: He sat down near him, who was scraping the earth under the cart.

original: taṃ hābhyuvāda tvaṃ nu bhagavaḥ sayugvā raikva iti /
analyzed: tam ha abhyuvāda tvam nu sayugvā raikvaḥ iti
translated: He addressed him, 'Are you, Sir, the Râikva who has a yoke of oxen?'

original: ahaṃ hy arā iti ha pratijajñe /
analyzed: aham hi iti ha pratijajñe
translated: 'I am he,' he replied.

analyzed: sa ha kṣattā avidam iti pratyeyāya
translated: Then Kshattri went away, saying, 'This is known.'

original: tad u ha jānaśrutiḥ pautrāyaṇaḥ ṣaṭ śatāni gavāṃ niṣkam aśvatarīrathaṃ tad ādāya praticakrame /🔽taṃ hābhyuvāda // / / //
analyzed: tat u ha jānaśrutiḥ pautrāyaṇaḥ ṣaḍ śatāni gavām niṣkam aśvatarī ratham tat ādāya praticakrame  tam ha abhyuvāda
translated: Now Janashruti's grandson, having given him six hundred cows, a gold coin, and a chariot with a team of mules, went away.

original: raikvemāni ṣaṭ śatāni gavām ayaṃ niṣko 'yam aśvatarīrathaḥ /
analyzed: raikva imāni ṣaḍ śatāni gavām ayam niṣkaḥ yam aśvatarī rathaḥ
translated: He addressed him, 'Râikva, these six hundred cows, this gold coin, and this chariot with a team of mules,

original: anu ma etāṃ bhagavo devatāṃ śādhi yāṃ devatām upāssa iti // / / //
analyzed: anu me etām bhagavaḥ devatām śādhi yām devatām upāsse iti
translated: teach me, Sir, that deity on which you meditate.'

original: tam u ha paraḥ pratyuvācāha hāretvā śūdra tavaiva saha gobhir astv iti /
analyzed: tam u ha paraḥ pratyuvāca āha śūdra tava eva saha gobhiḥ astu iti
translated: The other replied, 'Take them away, Sûdra, let them be yours with the cows.'

original: tad u ha punar eva jānaśrutiḥ pautrāyaṇaḥ sahasraṃ gavāṃ niṣkam aśvatarīrathaṃ duhitaraṃ tad ādāya praticakrame // / / //
analyzed: tat u ha punar eva jānaśrutiḥ pautrāyaṇaḥ sahasram gavām niṣkam aśvatarī ratham duhitaram tat ādāya praticakrame
translated: Then Janashruti's grandson, having given him a thousand cows, a gold coin, a chariot with a team of mules, and his daughter, went away.

analyzed: tam ha abhyuvāda
translated: He addressed him, 'Râikva, these thousand cows, this gold coin, this chariot with a team of mules, and this daughter,

original: raikvedaṃ sahasraṃ gavām ayaṃ niṣko 'yam aśvatarīratha iyaṃ jāyāyaṃ grāmo yasminn āsse 'nv eva mā bhagavaḥ śādhīti // / / //
analyzed: raikva idam sahasram gavām ayam niṣkaḥ yam aśvatarī rathaḥ iyam grāmaḥ yasmin āsse nu eva mā bhagavaḥ śādhi iti
translated: 'Rekvā, this thousand of cows, this gold necklace, this chariot with mules, this wife, this village where you live, instruct me, revered sir, in all this.'

original: tasyā ha mukham upodgṛhṇann uvācājahāremāḥ śūdrānenaiva mukhenālāpayiṣyathā iti /
analyzed: tasyāḥ ha mukham upodgṛhṇan uvāca ājahāra imāḥ śūdra anena eva mukhena alāpayiṣyathāḥ iti
translated: He, taking hold of his mouth, said, 'You will drive away these Śūdras with this very mouth with which you converse.'

original: te haite raikvaparṇā nāma mahāvṛṣeṣu yatrāsmā uvāsa /
analyzed: te ha ete raikvaparṇāḥ nāma mahāvṛṣeṣu yatra asmai uvāsa
translated: These are the ones called Rekvāparṇā, where he lived among the Mahāvṛṣas.

analyzed: tasmai ha uvāca
translated: To him he said...

analyzed: vāyuḥ vāva saṃvargaḥ
translated: The wind indeed is the gatherer.

original: yadā vā agnir udvāyati vāyum evāpyeti /🔽yadā sūryo 'stam eti vāyum evāpyeti /
analyzed: yadā vai agniḥ udvāyati vāyum eva apyeti  yadā sūryaḥ u stam eti vāyum eva apyeti
translated: When the fire goes out, it enters the wind.🔽When the sun sets, it enters the wind.

analyzed: yadā candraḥ u stam eti vāyum eva apyeti
translated: When the moon sets, it enters the wind.

analyzed: yadā āpaḥ ucchuṣyanti vāyum eva apiyanti
translated: When the waters dry up, they enter the wind.

analyzed: vāyuḥ hi eva etān sarvān saṃvṛṅkte
translated: For the wind indeed gathers all these together.

analyzed: iti adhidaivatam
translated: Thus in regard to the gods.

analyzed: atha adhyātmam  prāṇaḥ vāva samvargaḥ
translated: Now in regard to the self.🔽The breath indeed is the gatherer.

original: sa yadā svapiti prāṇam eva vāg apy eti /🔽prāṇaṃ cakṣuḥ /
analyzed: sa yadā svapiti prāṇam eva vāc api eti  prāṇam cakṣuḥ
translated: When one sleeps, speech enters the breath.🔽The eye enters the breath.

analyzed: prāṇam śrotram
translated: The ear enters the breath.

analyzed: prāṇam manaḥ
translated: The mind enters the breath.

original: prāṇo hy evaitān sarvān saṃvṛṅkta iti // / / //
analyzed: prāṇaḥ hi eva etān sarvān saṃvṛṅkte iti
translated: For the breath indeed gathers all these together.

analyzed: tau vai etau dvau samvargau
translated: These two are the two Samvargas.

analyzed: vāyuḥ eva deveṣu prāṇaḥ prāṇeṣu
translated: Vayu among the gods, Prana among the vital airs...

original: atha ha śaunakaṃ ca kāpeyam abhipratāriṇaṃ ca kākṣaseniṃ pariviṣyamāṇau brahmacārī bibhikṣe /
analyzed: atha ha śaunakam ca kāpeyam abhipratāriṇam ca kākṣasenim pariviṣyamāṇau brahmacārī bibhikṣe
translated: Then a Brahmachari begged from Shaunaka Kapeya and Abhipatara Abhikshaseni, while they were being served.

analyzed: tasmai u ha na dadatuḥ
translated: They did not give to him...

analyzed: sa ha uvāca
translated: He said:

original: mahātmanaś caturo deva ekaḥ kaḥ sa jagāra bhuvanasya gopāḥ /
analyzed: mahātmanaḥ caturaḥ devaḥ ekaḥ kaḥ sa jagāra bhuvanasya gopāḥ
translated: The one great soul of the gods, the protector of the world, who swallows the four great ones.

original: taṃ kāpeya nābhipaśyanti martyā abhipratārin bahudhā vasantam /
analyzed: tam kāpeya na abhipaśyanti martyāḥ abhipratārin bahudhā vasantam
translated: O Kapeya, mortals do not see him, who dwells in many ways, O Abhipatara.

original: yasmai vā etad annaṃ tasmā etan na dattam iti // / / //
analyzed: yasmai vai etat annam tasmai etat na dattam iti
translated: To whom this food belongs, to him it has not been given.

original: tad u ha śaunakaḥ kāpeyaḥ pratimanvānaḥ pratyeyāya /
analyzed: tat u ha śaunakaḥ kāpeyaḥ pratimanvānaḥ pratyeyāya
translated: Then Shaunaka Kapeya, remembering, replied:

original: ātmā devānāṃ janitā prajānāṃ hiraṅyadaṃṣṭro babhaso 'nasūriḥ /
analyzed: ātmā devānām janitā prajānām hiraṅya daṃṣṭraḥ babhasaḥ nasūriḥ
translated: The soul of the gods, the progenitor of creatures, with golden teeth, the all-devouring, the unsullied,

original: mahāntam asya mahimānam āhur anadyamāno yad anannam atti /
analyzed: mahāntam asya mahimānam āhuḥ an adyamānaḥ yat an annam atti
translated: They say his greatness is great, that he eats food without being filled.

original: iti vai vayam brahmacārin nedam upāsmahe dattāsmai bhikṣām iti // / / //
analyzed: iti vai vayam brahmacārin na idam upāsmahe datta asmai bhikṣām iti
translated: Thus, O Brahmachari, we worship this. Give him alms.

analyzed: tasmai u ha daduḥ
translated: They gave to him.

original: te vā ete pañcānye pañcānye daśa santas tat kṛtam /
analyzed: te vai ete pañca anye pañca anye daśa santaḥ tat kṛtam
translated: These are five, and those are five, being ten, that is done.

original: tasmāt sarvāsu dikṣv annam eva daśa kṛtam /
analyzed: tasmāt sarvāsu dikṣu annam eva daśa kṛtam
translated: Therefore, food is indeed given in all directions.

analyzed: sā eṣā virāj annādī
translated: This is indeed Virāj, the eater of food.

analyzed: tayā idam sarvam dṛṣṭam
translated: By it, all this is seen.

original: sarvam asya idaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ bhavaty annādo bhavati ya evaṃ veda ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: sarvam asya idam dṛṣṭam bhavati anna ādaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda yaḥ evam veda
translated: All this is seen by him, he becomes an eater of food, who knows this, who knows this.

original: satyakāmo ha jābālo jabālāṃ mātaram āmantrayāṃ cakre /
analyzed: satyakāmaḥ ha jābālaḥ jabālām mātaram āmantrayāṃ cakre
translated: Satyakāma Jābāla said to his mother Jābālā:

original: brahmacaryaṃ bhavati vivatsyāmi kiṃgotro nv aham asmīti // / / //
analyzed: brahmacaryam bhavati vivatsyāmi kiṃgotraḥ nu aham asmi iti
translated: I will live the life of a celibate student. What is my gotra?

analyzed: sā ha enam uvāca
translated: She said to him:

original: nāham etad veda tāta yadgotras tvam asi /
analyzed: na aham etat veda tāta yad gotraḥ tvam asi
translated: I do not know, dear, what your gotra is.

original: bahv aham carantī paricāriṇī yauvane tvām alabhe /
analyzed: bahu aham carantī paricāriṇī yauvane tvām alabhe
translated: I was a wandering servant and obtained you in my youth.

original: sāham etan na veda yadgotras tvam asi /
analyzed: sā aham etat na veda yad gotraḥ tvam asi
translated: So I do not know what your gotra is.

analyzed: jabālā tu nāma aham asmi
translated: But I am named Jābālā.

analyzed: satya kāmaḥ nāma tvam asi
translated: And you are named Satyākāma.

original: sa satyakāma eva jābālo bruvīthā iti // / / //
analyzed: sa satyakāmaḥ eva jābālaḥ bruvīthāḥ iti
translated: You should say 'I am Satyākāma Jābāla.'

analyzed: sa ha hāridrumatam gautamam etya uvāca
translated: He went to Hāridrumata Gautama and said:

analyzed: brahmacaryam bhagavati vatsyāmi
translated: Sir, I will live the life of a celibate student with you.

analyzed: upeyām bhagavantam iti
translated: I will approach you, sir.

analyzed: tam ha uvāca kiṃgotraḥ nu somya asi iti
translated: He said to him: What is your gotra, O Somaputra?

analyzed: sa ha uvāca
translated: He said:

original: nāham etad veda bho yadgotro 'ham asmi /
analyzed: na aham etat veda bho yad gotraḥ ham asmi
translated: I do not know, sir, what family I belong to.

analyzed: apṛccham mātaram
translated: I asked my mother.

original: sā mā pratyabravīd bahv aham carantī paricariṇī yauvane tvām alabhe /
analyzed: sā mā pratyabravīt bahu aham carantī paricariṇī yauvane tvām alabhe
translated: She replied to me: 'I, who was a maid-servant, obtained you in my youth while wandering about.'

original: sāham etan na veda yadgotras tvam asi /
analyzed: sā aham etat na veda yad gotraḥ tvam asi
translated: So I do not know what family you belong to.

analyzed: jabālā tu nāma aham asmi
translated: But I am named Jabala.

analyzed: satya kāmaḥ nāma tvam asi iti
translated: And you are named Satyakama.

analyzed: saḥ ham satyakāmaḥ jābālaḥ smi bho iti
translated: So I am Satyakama Jabala, sir.

analyzed: tam ha uvāca
translated: He said to him:

analyzed: na etat abrahmaṇaḥ vivaktum arhati
translated: You should not speak this without knowing Brahman.

analyzed: samidham somya āhara
translated: Bring a piece of wood, my dear.

original: upa tvā neṣye na satyād agā iti /
analyzed: upa tvā neṣye na satyāt agāḥ iti
translated: I will take you to your teacher. You have not gone beyond the truth.

original: tam upanīya kṛśānām abalānāṃ catuḥśatā gā nirākṛtya uvācemāḥ somyānusaṃvrajeti /
analyzed: tam upanīya kṛśānām abalānām catur śatāḥ gāḥ nirākṛtya uvāca imāḥ somya anusaṃvraja iti
translated: Having initiated him, he drove away four hundred lean and weak cows and said, My dear, follow these.

analyzed: tāḥ abhiprasthāpayan uvāca
translated: As he was driving them away, he said:

analyzed: na a sahasreṇa āvarteya iti
translated: I will not return without a thousand.

analyzed: sa ha varṣa gaṇam provāsa
translated: He lived there for many years.

analyzed: tāḥ yadā sahasram sampeduḥ
translated: When they reached a thousand,

analyzed: atha ha enam ṛṣabhaḥ bhyuvāda satyakāmaḥ iti
translated: then a bull addressed him, saying, Satyakama.

analyzed: bhagavaḥ iti ha pratiśuśrāva
translated: Sir, he replied.

analyzed: prāptāḥ somya sahasram smaḥ
translated: We have reached a thousand, my dear.

analyzed: prāpaya naḥ ācārya kulam
translated: Take us to the teacher's house.

original: brahmaṇaś ca te pādaṃ bravāṇi iti /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ ca te pādam bravāṇi iti
translated: and I will tell you about a quarter of Brahman.'

analyzed: bravītu me bhagavān iti
translated: 'May the revered one tell me,' (said he).

analyzed: tasmai ha uvāca  prācī diś kalā
translated: He said to him:🔽'The eastern direction is a part.

analyzed: praticī diś kalā  dakṣiṇā diś kalā
translated: The western direction is a part.🔽The southern direction is a part.

analyzed: udīcī diś kalā
translated: The northern direction is a part.

analyzed: brahma vid iva vai somya bhāsi

analyzed: anye manuṣyebhyaḥ iti ha pratijajñe

original: bhagavāṃs tv eva me kāme brūyāt // / / //

analyzed: tasmai ha etat eva uvāca

analyzed: atra ha na kiṃcana vīyāya iti vīyāya iti

original: tasya ha dvādaśa vārṣāny agnīn paricacāra /
