translated: From the moon, the lightning.

analyzed: tat puruṣaḥ mānavaḥ
translated: That is the superhuman person.

analyzed: saḥ enān brahma gamayati
translated: He leads them to Brahman.

analyzed: eṣa deva pathaḥ brahma pathaḥ
translated: This is the path of the gods, the path of Brahman.

original: etena pratipadyamānā imaṃ mānavam āvartaṃ nāvartante nāvartante // / / //
analyzed: etena pratipadyamānāḥ imam mānavam āvartam na āvartante na āvartante
translated: Those who proceed by this do not return to this human cycle. They do not return.

original: eṣa ha vai yajño yo 'yaṃ pavate /🔽eṣa ha yann idaṃ sarvaṃ punāti /
analyzed: eṣa ha vai yajñaḥ yaḥ yam pavate  eṣa ha yan idam sarvam punāti
translated: This indeed is the sacrifice that blows here.🔽This indeed purifies everything here.

original: yad eṣa yann idaṃ sarvaṃ punāti /
analyzed: yat eṣa yan idam sarvam punāti
translated: Because this purifies everything here,

analyzed: tasmāt eṣaḥ eva yajñaḥ
translated: therefore this is the sacrifice.

original: tasya manaś ca vāk ca vartanī // / / //
analyzed: tasya manaḥ ca vāc ca vartanī
translated: Its two paths are the mind and speech.

analyzed: tayoḥ anyatarām manasā saṃskaroti brahmā
translated: The Brahman priest purifies one of them with the mind,

analyzed: vācā hotā adhvaryuḥ udgātā anyatarām
translated: the Hotṛ, Adhvaryu, and Udgātṛ priests the other with speech.

original: sa yatropākṛte prātaranuvāke purā paridhānīyāyā brahmā vyavavadati // / / //🔽anyatarām eva vartanīṃ saṃskaroti /
analyzed: sa yatra upākṛte prātaranuvāke purā paridhānīyāyāḥ brahmā vyavavadati  anyatarām eva vartanīm saṃskaroti
translated: When the Brahman speaks before the Paridhānīya verse, in the morning recitation that has been begun,🔽he makes one path smooth,

analyzed: hīyate nyatarā
translated: and the other one is lost.

original: sa yathaikapād vrajan ratho vaikena cakreṇa vartamāno riṣyaty evam asya yajño riṣyati /
analyzed: sa yathā eka pād vrajan rathaḥ vā ekena cakreṇa vartamānaḥ riṣyati evam asya yajñaḥ riṣyati
translated: Just as a chariot going on one wheel, with one foot, is lost, so is his sacrifice lost.

analyzed: yajñam riṣyantam yajamānaḥ nu riṣyati
translated: When the sacrifice is lost, the sacrificer is lost.

analyzed: saḥ iṣṭvā pāpīyān bhavati
translated: Having sacrificed, he becomes worse.

original: atha yatra upākṛte prātaranuvāke na purā paridhānīyāyā brahmā vyavavadaty ubhe eva vartanī saṃskurvanti /
analyzed: atha yatra upākṛte prātaranuvāke na purā paridhānīyāyāḥ brahmā vyavavadati ubhe eva vartanī saṃskurvanti
translated: Now, when the Brahman does not speak before the Paridhānīya verse, in the morning recitation that has been begun, they make both paths smooth.

analyzed: na hīyate nyatarā
translated: Neither one is lost.

original: sa yathobhayapād vrajan ratho vobhābhyāṃ cakrābhyāṃ vartamānaḥ pratitiṣṭhaty evam asya yajñaḥ pratitiṣṭhati yajñaṃ pratitiṣṭhantaṃ yajamāno
analyzed: sa yathā ubhaya pād vrajan rathaḥ vā ubhābhyām cakrābhyām vartamānaḥ pratitiṣṭhati evam asya yajñaḥ pratitiṣṭhati yajñam pratitiṣṭhantam yajamānaḥ
translated: Just as a chariot going on both wheels, with both feet, stands firm, so does his sacrifice stand firm. When the sacrifice stands firm, the sacrificer

analyzed: nu pratitiṣṭhati
translated: stands firm after it.

analyzed: saḥ iṣṭvā śreyān bhavati
translated: Having sacrificed, he becomes better.

analyzed: prajāpatiḥ lokān abhyatapat
translated: Prajapati scorched the worlds.

analyzed: teṣām tapyamānānām rasān prāvṛhat
translated: From them, while being scorched, he extracted the juices.

analyzed: agnim pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Agni from the earth,

analyzed: vāyum antarikṣāt
translated: Vayu from the atmosphere.

analyzed: ādityam divaḥ
translated: The sun from the sky.

analyzed: saḥ etāḥ tisraḥ devatāḥ abhyatapat
translated: He heated those three deities.

analyzed: tāsām tapyamānānām rasān prāvṛhat
translated: From them, while being heated, he extracted the juices.

analyzed: agneḥ ṛcaḥ
translated: The Ṛc verses from Agni.

analyzed: vāyoḥ yajūṃṣi
translated: The Yajuṣ formulas from Vāyu.

analyzed: sāmāni ādityāt
translated: The Sāman chants from the sun.

analyzed: saḥ etām trayīm vidyām abhyatapat
translated: He heated that threefold knowledge.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tapyamānāyāḥ rasān prāvṛhat
translated: From it, while being heated, he extracted the juices.

analyzed: bhūḥ iti ṛgbhyaḥ
translated: Bhūḥ from the Ṛc verses.

analyzed: bhuvar iti yajurbhyaḥ
translated: Bhuvaḥ from the Yajuṣ formulas.

analyzed: svar iti sāmabhyaḥ
translated: Svaḥ from the Sāman chants.

original: tad yady ṛkto riṣyed bhūḥ svāheti gārhapatye juhuyāt /
analyzed: tat yadi ṛktaḥ riṣyet bhūḥ svāhā iti gārhapatye juhuyāt
translated: If it is spoiled by Ṛc, one should offer into the Gārhapatya with Bhūḥ svāhā.

original: ṛcām eva tadrasenarcāṃ vīryeṇarcāṃ yajñasya viriṣṭaṃ saṃdadhāti // / / //
analyzed: ṛcām eva tat rasena ṛcām vīryeṇa ṛcām yajñasya viriṣṭam saṃdadhāti
translated: With the juice of the Ṛc verses, with the vigor of the Ṛc verses, he joins the broken part of the sacrifice with the Ṛc verses.

original: atha yadi yajuṣṭo riṣyed bhuvaḥ svāheti dakṣiṇāgnau juhuyāt /
analyzed: atha yadi yajuṣṭaḥ riṣyet bhuvaḥ svāhā iti dakṣiṇāgnau juhuyāt
translated: If it is spoiled by Yajuṣ, one should offer into the Dakṣiṇāgni with Bhuvaḥ svāhā.

original: yajuṣām eva tadrasena yajuṣāṃ vīryeṇa yajuṣāṃ yajñasya viriṣṭaṃ saṃdadhāti // / / //
analyzed: yajuṣām eva tat rasena yajuṣām vīryeṇa yajuṣām yajñasya viriṣṭam saṃdadhāti
translated: With the juice of the Yajuṣ formulas, with the vigor of the Yajuṣ formulas, he joins the broken part of the sacrifice with the Yajuṣ formulas.

original: atha yadi sāmato riṣyet svaḥ svāhety āhavanīye juhuyāt /
analyzed: atha yadi sāmataḥ riṣyet svar svāhā iti āhavanīye juhuyāt
translated: If it is spoiled by Sāman, one should offer into the Āhavanīya with Svaḥ svāhā.

original: sāmnām eva tadrasena sāmnāṃ vīryeṇa sāmnāṃ yajñasya viriṣṭaṃ saṃdadhāti // / / //
analyzed: sāmnām eva tat rasena sāmnām vīryeṇa sāmnām yajñasya viriṣṭam saṃdadhāti
translated: With the juice of the Sāman chants, with the vigor of the Sāman chants, he joins the broken part of the sacrifice with the Sāman chants.

analyzed: tat yathā lavaṇena suvarṇam saṃdadhyāt
translated: Just as one would join gold with salt,

original: suvarṇena rajataṃ rajatena trapu trapuṇā sīsaṃ sīsena lohaṃ lohena dāru dāru carmaṇā // / / //
analyzed: suvarṇena rajatam rajatena trapu trapuṇā sīsam sīsena loham lohena dāru dāru carmaṇā
translated: gold with silver, silver with tin, tin with lead, lead with iron, iron with wood, wood with leather, etc.

original: evam eṣāṃ lokānām āsāṃ devatānām asyās trayyā vidyāyā vīryeṇa yajñasya viriṣṭaṃ saṃdadhāti /🔽bheṣajakṛto ha vā eṣa yajño yatraivaṃvid brahmā bhavati // / / //
analyzed: evam eṣām lokānām āsām devatānām asyāḥ trayyāḥ vidyāyāḥ vīryeṇa yajñasya viriṣṭam saṃdadhāti  bheṣaja kṛtaḥ ha vai eṣa yajñaḥ yatra evaṃvid brahmā bhavati
translated: In this way, by the power of these worlds, these deities, and this threefold knowledge, he joins the breach in the sacrifice.🔽Indeed, this sacrifice is healed where there is a Brahman priest who knows thus.

original: eṣa ha vā udakpravaṇo yajño yatraivaṃvid brahmā bhavati /
analyzed: eṣa ha vai udak pravaṇaḥ yajñaḥ yatra evaṃvid brahmā bhavati
translated: Indeed, this sacrifice flows towards the north where there is a Brahman priest who knows thus.

original: evaṃvidaṃ ha vā eṣā brahmāṇam anu gāthā /
analyzed: evaṃvidam ha vai eṣā brahmāṇam anu gāthā
translated: Indeed, this verse is sung about such a Brahman priest:

original: yato yata āvartate tat tad gacchati // / / //
analyzed: yatas yatas āvartate tat tat gacchati
translated: Wherever he turns, that is where he goes.

analyzed: mānavaḥ
translated: The human one.

analyzed: brahmā eva ekaḥ ṛtvij kurūn aśva abhirakṣati
translated: Brahman alone, as the sole priest, protects the Kurus and the horses.

original: evaṃvid dha vai brahmā yajñaṃ yajamānaṃ sarvāṃś cartvijo 'bhirakṣati /
analyzed: evaṃvid ha vai brahmā yajñam yajamānam sarvān ca ṛtvijaḥ bhirakṣati
translated: Indeed, a Brahman priest who knows thus protects the sacrifice, the sacrificer, and all the priests.

original: tasmād evaṃvidam eva brahmāṇaṃ kurvīta nānevaṃvidaṃ nānevaṃvidam // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt evaṃvidam eva brahmāṇam kurvīta na an evaṃvidam na an evaṃvidam
translated: Therefore, one should appoint only such a Brahman priest, not one who does not know thus, not one who does not know thus.

original: yo ha vai jyeṣṭhaṃ ca śreṣṭhaṃ ca veda jyeṣṭhaś ca ha vai śreṣṭhaś ca bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai jyeṣṭham ca śreṣṭham ca veda jyeṣṭhaḥ ca ha vai śreṣṭhaḥ ca bhavati
translated: One who knows the eldest and the best becomes the eldest and the best himself.

original: prāṇo vāva jyeṣṭhaś ca śreṣṭhaś ca // / / //
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vāva jyeṣṭhaḥ ca śreṣṭhaḥ ca
translated: Breath indeed is the oldest and the best.

original: yo ha vai vasiṣṭhaṃ veda vasiṣṭho ha svānāṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai vasiṣṭham veda vasiṣṭhaḥ ha svānām bhavati
translated: He who knows the best becomes the best of his own people.

analyzed: vāc vāva vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: Speech indeed is the best.

original: yo ha vai pratiṣṭhāṃ veda prati ha tiṣṭhaty asmiṃś ca loke 'muṣmiṃś ca /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai pratiṣṭhām veda prati ha tiṣṭhati asmin ca loke muṣmin ca
translated: He who knows the support finds support in this world and the next.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ vāva pratiṣṭhā
translated: The eye indeed is the support.

original: yo ha vai saṃpadaṃ veda saṃ hāsmai kāmāḥ padyante daivāś ca mānuṣāś ca /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai saṃpadam veda sam ha asmai kāmāḥ padyante daivāḥ ca mānuṣāḥ ca
translated: He who knows the fulfilment finds his desires fulfilled, both divine and human.

analyzed: śrotram vāva saṃpad
translated: The ear indeed is the fulfilment.

original: yo ha vā āyatanaṃ vedāyatanaṃ ha svānāṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai āyatanam veda āyatanam ha svānām bhavati
translated: He who knows the abode becomes the abode of his own people.

analyzed: manaḥ ha vai āyatanam
translated: The mind indeed is the abode.

analyzed: atha ha prāṇāḥ ahaṃśreyasi vyūdire
translated: Then the vital breaths disputed about who was the best.

original: ahaṃ śreyān asmy ahaṃ śreyān asmīti // / / //
analyzed: aham śreyān asmi aham śreyān asmi iti
translated: Each said, I am the best! I am the best!

original: te ha prāṇāḥ prajāpatiṃ pitaram etyocuḥ bhagavan ko naḥ śreṣṭha iti /
analyzed: te ha prāṇāḥ prajāpatim pitaram etya ūcuḥ bhagavan kaḥ naḥ śreṣṭhaḥ iti
translated: Those vital breaths went to Prajapati, their father, and said, O Lord, who is the best among us?

analyzed: tān ha uvāca
translated: He said to them:

analyzed: yasmin utkrānte śarīram pāpiṣṭhataram iva dṛśyeta sa vaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ iti
translated: He among whom, when it departs, the body appears most wretched, he is the best among you.

analyzed: sā ha vāc uccakrāma
translated: Then speech departed.

analyzed: sā saṃvatsaram proṣya paryetya uvāca
translated: Having stayed away for a year, it returned and said:🔽I am speech, I am the best among you.

analyzed: katham aśakata ṛte mat jīvitum iti
translated: How were you able to live without me?

original: yathā kalā avadantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena paśyantaś cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa dhyāyanto manasaivam iti /
analyzed: yathā kalāḥ a vadantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa dhyāyantaḥ manasā evam iti
translated: Just as those who speak with the voice, breathe with the breath, see with the eye, hear with the ear, and think with the mind.

analyzed: praviveśa ha vāc
translated: Speech entered him.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ ha uccakrāma
translated: The eye departed.

analyzed: tat saṃvatsaram proṣya paryetya uvāca
translated: Having stayed away for a year, it returned and said,

analyzed: katham aśakata ṛte mat jīvitum iti
translated: How were you able to live without me?

original: yathāndhā apaśyantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadanto vācā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa dhyāyanto manasaivam iti /
analyzed: yathā andhāḥ a paśyantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadantaḥ vācā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa dhyāyantaḥ manasā evam iti
translated: Just as the blind, not seeing, breathing with the breath, speaking with the voice, hearing with the ear, and thinking with the mind.

analyzed: praviveśa ha cakṣuḥ
translated: The eye entered him.

analyzed: śrotram ha uccakrāma
translated: The ear departed.

original: tat saṃvatsaraṃ proṣya paryetyovāca katham aśakatarte maj jīvitum iti /
analyzed: tat saṃvatsaram proṣya paryetya uvāca katham aśakata ṛte mat jīvitum iti
translated: Having stayed away for a year, it returned and said, How were you able to live without me?

original: yathā badhirā aśṛṇvantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadanto vācā paśyantaś cakṣuṣā dhyāyanto manasaivam iti /
analyzed: yathā badhirāḥ a śṛṇvantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadantaḥ vācā paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā dhyāyantaḥ manasā evam iti
translated: Just as the deaf, not hearing, breathing with the breath, speaking with the voice, seeing with the eye, and thinking with the mind.

analyzed: praviveśa ha śrotram
translated: The ear entered him.

analyzed: manaḥ ha uccakrāma
translated: The mind departed.

analyzed: tat saṃvatsaram proṣya paryetya uvāca
translated: Having stayed away for a year, it returned and said,

analyzed: katham aśakata ṛte mat jīvitum iti
translated: How were you able to live without me?

original: yathā bālā amanasaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadanto vācā paśyantaś cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇaivam iti /
analyzed: yathā bālāḥ amanasaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadantaḥ vācā paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa evam iti
translated: As the foolish, mindless, breathing with breath, speaking with speech, seeing with the eye, hearing with the ear, thus.

analyzed: praviveśa ha manaḥ
translated: The mind entered him.

original: atha ha prāṇa uccikramiṣan sa yathā suhayaḥ paḍvīśaśaṅkūn saṃkhided evam itarān prāṇān samakhidat /
analyzed: atha ha prāṇaḥ uccikramiṣan sa yathā su hayaḥ paḍvīśa śaṅkūn saṃkhidet evam itarān prāṇān samakhidat
translated: Then the breath, desiring to go out, just as a good horse would pull out the pegs, so it pulled out the other breaths.

analyzed: tam ha abhisametya ūcuḥ
translated: They approached him and said:

analyzed: bhagavan edhi
translated: Lord, stay.🔽You are our best.

analyzed: tvam naḥ śreṣṭhaḥ si  mā utkramīḥ iti
translated: Do not go out.

analyzed: atha ha enam vāc uvāca
translated: Then speech said to him:

analyzed: yat aham vasiṣṭhaḥ smi tvam tad vasiṣṭhaḥ si iti
translated: Inasmuch as I am the best, you are the best.

analyzed: atha ha enam cakṣuḥ uvāca
translated: Then the eye said to him:

analyzed: yat aham pratiṣṭhā asmi tvam tad pratiṣṭhā asi iti
translated: Inasmuch as I am the support, you are the support.

analyzed: atha ha enam śrotram uvāca
translated: Then the ear said to him:

original: yad ahaṃ saṃpad asmi tvaṃ tatsaṃpad asīti /
analyzed: yat aham saṃpad asmi tvam tat saṃpad asi iti
translated: Inasmuch as I am the completion, you are the completion.

analyzed: atha ha enam manaḥ uvāca
translated: Then the mind said to him:

original: yad aham āyatanam asmi tvaṃ tadāyatanam asīti // / / //
analyzed: yat aham āyatanam asmi tvam tad āyatanam asi iti
translated: Inasmuch as I am the abode, you are the abode.

original: na vai vāco na cakṣūṃṣi na śrotrāṇi na manāṃsīty ācakṣate /
analyzed: na vai vācaḥ na cakṣūṃṣi na śrotrāṇi na manāṃsi iti ācakṣate
translated: They do not call them the voices, the eyes, the ears, the minds.

analyzed: prāṇāḥ iti eva ācakṣate
translated: They call them the breaths.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ hi eva etāni sarvāṇi bhavati
translated: for the breath is all these things.

original: sa hovāca kiṃ me 'nnaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /🔽yat kiṃcid idam ā śvabhya ā śakunibhya iti hocuḥ /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca kim me nnam bhaviṣyati iti  yat kiṃcid idam ā śvabhyaḥ ā śakunibhyaḥ iti ha ūcuḥ
translated: He said, 'What will be my food?'🔽'Whatever there is from dogs to birds,' they said.

analyzed: tat vai etat anasya annam
translated: That is indeed the food of the mouth.

analyzed: anaḥ ha vai nāma pratyakṣam
translated: The mouth is indeed the manifest name.

original: na ha vā evaṃvidi kiṃcanānannaṃ bhavatīti // / / //
analyzed: na ha vai evaṃvidi kiṃcana anannam bhavati iti
translated: For one who knows thus, there is nothing that is not food.

original: sa hovāca kiṃ me vāso bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca kim me vāsaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: He said, 'What will be my clothing?'

analyzed: āpaḥ iti ha ūcuḥ

original: tasmād vā etad aśiṣyantaḥ purastāc copariṣṭāc cādbhiḥ paridadhati /
analyzed: tasmāt vai etat a śiṣyantaḥ purastāt ca upariṣṭāt ca adbhiḥ paridadhati
translated: Therefore, when about to eat, they surround it with water on all sides.

analyzed: lambhukaḥ ha vāsaḥ bhavati
translated: The clothing is ample.

analyzed: anagnaḥ ha bhavati
translated: One is not naked.

original: tad dhaitat satyakāmo jābālo gośrutaye vaiyāghrapadyāyoktvovāca /
analyzed: tat ha etat satyakāmaḥ jābālaḥ gośrutaye vaiyāghrapadyāya uktvā uvāca
translated: Now, this Satyakama Jabala, having said this to Goshrutin, the son of Vyaghrapada, said:

original: yady apy enac chuṣkāya sthāṇave brūyāj jāyerann evāsmiñ chākhāḥ praroheyuḥ palāśānīti // / / //
analyzed: yadi api enat śuṣkāya sthāṇave brūyāt jāyeran eva asmin śākhāḥ praroheyuḥ palāśāni iti
translated: 'Even if one were to tell this to a dry stump, branches would grow out of it and leaves would sprout.'

analyzed: atha yadi mahat jigamiṣet
translated: Now, if one wishes to go on a long journey,

original: amāvāsyāyām dīkṣitvā paurṇamāsyāṃ rātrau sarvauṣadhasya mantham dadhimadhunor upamathya jyeṣṭhāya śreṣṭhāya svāhety agnāv ājyasya hutvā manthe
analyzed: amāvāsyāyām dīkṣitvā paurṇamāsyām rātrau sarva auṣadhasya mantham dadhi madhunoḥ upamathya jyeṣṭhāya śreṣṭhāya svāhā iti agnau ājyasya hutvā manthe
translated: Having initiated on the new moon day, at night on the full moon day, having churned all the herbs with curds and honey, having offered ghee in the fire with To the eldest, to the best, svāhā,

analyzed: saṃpātam avanayet
translated: he should pour the remnants into the churn.

original: vasiṣṭhāya svāhety agnāv ājyasya hutvā manthe saṃpātam avanayet /🔽pratiṣṭhāyai svāhety agnāv ājyasya hutvā manthe saṃpātam avanayet /🔽saṃpade svāhety agnāv ājyasya hutvā manthe saṃpātam avanayet /

analyzed: tān ha uvāca

analyzed: tasya anu tṛptim tṛpyati prajayā paśubhiḥ annādyena tejasā brahmavarcasena iti
translated: By its satisfaction, he is satisfied with offspring, cattle, food, splendor, and brahmic glory.

original: atha yām pañcamīṃ juhuyāt tāṃ juhuyāt udānāya svāheti /
analyzed: atha yām pañcamīm juhuyāt tām juhuyāt udānāya svāhā iti
translated: Then the fifth oblation he should offer with To the upward moving breath svāhā.

analyzed: udānaḥ tṛpyati
translated: The upward moving breath is satisfied.

original: udāne tṛpyati tvak tṛpyati tvaci tṛpyantyāṃ vāyus tṛpyati /
analyzed: udāne tṛpyati tvac tṛpyati tvaci tṛpyantyām vāyuḥ tṛpyati
translated: When the upward moving breath is satisfied, the skin is satisfied. When the skin is satisfied, the wind is satisfied.

analyzed: vāyau tṛpyati ākāśaḥ tṛpyati
translated: When the wind is satisfied, space is satisfied.

original: ākāśe tṛpyati yat kiṃca vāyuś cākāśaś cādhitiṣṭhatas tat tṛpyati /
analyzed: ākāśe tṛpyati yat kiṃca vāyuḥ ca ākāśaḥ ca adhitiṣṭhataḥ tat tṛpyati
translated: When space is satisfied, whatever is presided over by the wind and space is satisfied.

original: tasyānu tṛptiṃ tṛpyati prajayā paśubhir annādyena tejasā brahmavarcaseneti // / / //
analyzed: tasya anu tṛptim tṛpyati prajayā paśubhiḥ annādyena tejasā brahmavarcasena iti
translated: By its satisfaction, he is satisfied with offspring, cattle, food, splendor, and brahmic glory.

original: sa ya idam avidvān agnihotraṃ juhoti yathāṅgārān apohya bhasmani juhuyāt tādṛk tat syāt // / / //
analyzed: sa yaḥ idam a vidvān agnihotram juhoti yathā aṅgārān apohya bhasmani juhuyāt tādṛś tat syāt
translated: He who offers the Agnihotra without knowing this, it would be as if he were to offer on ashes after removing the coals.

original: atha ya etad evaṃ vidvān agnihotraṃ juhoti tasya sarveṣu lokeṣu sarveṣu bhūteṣu sarveṣv ātmasu hutaṃ bhavati // / / //
analyzed: atha yaḥ etat evam vidvān agnihotram juhoti tasya sarveṣu lokeṣu sarveṣu bhūteṣu sarveṣu ātmasu hutam bhavati
translated: Now, he who, knowing this, offers the Agnihotra, for him it is offered in all the worlds, in all beings, in all the selves.

original: tad yatheṣīkātūlam agnau protaṃ pradūyetaivaṃ hāsya sarve pāpmānaḥ pradūyante ya etad evaṃ vidvān agnihotraṃ juhoti // / / //
analyzed: tat yathā iṣīkā tūlam agnau protam pradūyeta evam ha asya sarve pāpmānaḥ pradūyante yaḥ etat evam vidvān agnihotram juhoti
translated: Just as a piece of cotton thrown into a fire would be consumed, so are all his evil deeds consumed, he who, knowing this thus, offers the Agnihotra.

original: tasmād u haivaṃvid yady api caṇḍālāya ucchiṣṭaṃ prayacchet /
analyzed: tasmāt u ha evaṃvid yadi api caṇḍālāya ucchiṣṭam prayacchet
translated: Therefore, even if one who knows this thus should give the leavings to an outcaste,

original: ātmani haivāsya tad vaiśvānare hutaṃ syād iti /
analyzed: ātmani ha eva asya tat vaiśvānare hutam syāt iti
translated: it would be as if it were offered in his own self in the fire of Vaiśvānara.

analyzed: tat eṣa ślokaḥ
translated: This verse is about that.

analyzed: yathā iha kṣudhitāḥ bālāḥ mātaram paryupāsate
translated: Just as hungry children here wait upon their mother,

analyzed: evam sarvāṇi bhūtāni agnihotram upāsata
translated: so do all beings wait upon the Agnihotra.

analyzed: śvetaketuḥ ha āruṇeyaḥ āsa
translated: Śvetaketu Āruṇeya was there.

original: taṃ ha pitovāca śvetaketo vasa brahmacaryam /
analyzed: tam ha pitā uvāca śvetaketo vasa brahmacaryam
translated: His father said to him, Śvetaketu, live the life of a celibate student.

original: na vai somyāsmat kulīno 'nanūcya brahmabandhur iva bhavatīti // / / //
analyzed: na vai somya asmat kulīnaḥ nanūcya brahmabandhuḥ iva bhavati iti
translated: For, my dear, one who is not a relative of ours should not become a mere Brahman-bond, without having studied.

original: sa ha dvādaśavarṣa upetya caturviṃśativarṣaḥ sarvān vedān adhītya mahāmanā anūcānamānī stabdha eyāya /
analyzed: sa ha dvādaśa varṣaḥ upetya caturviṃśati varṣaḥ sarvān vedān adhītya mahāmanāḥ anūcāna mānī stabdhaḥ eyāya
translated: Having lived (with the teacher) for twelve years, and having studied all the Vedas, he returned at the age of twenty-four, conceited, proud of his learning, and arrogant.

analyzed: tam ha pitā uvāca
translated: His father said to him:

original: śvetaketo yan nu somyedaṃ mahāmanā anūcānamānī stabdho 'si /
analyzed: śvetaketo yat nu somya idam mahāmanāḥ anūcāna mānī stabdhaḥ si
translated: O Śvetaketu, you are indeed arrogant, a conceited student.

original: uta tam ādeśam aprākṣyaḥ yenāśrutaṃ śrutaṃ bhavaty amataṃ matam avijñātaṃ vijñātam iti /
analyzed: uta tam ādeśam aprākṣyaḥ yena a śrutam śrutam bhavati a matam matam a vijñātam vijñātam iti
translated: But you have asked about that instruction by which the unheard becomes heard, the unthought becomes thought, the unknown becomes known.

original: kathaṃ nu bhagavaḥ sa ādeśo bhavatīti // / / //
analyzed: katham nu bhagavaḥ saḥ ādeśaḥ bhavati iti
translated: How is that instruction, O revered one?

original: yathā somyaikena mṛtpiṇḍena sarvaṃ mṛnmayaṃ vijñātaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yathā somya ekena mṛd piṇḍena sarvam mṛd mayam vijñātam syāt
translated: Just as, my dear, by one clod of clay all that is made of clay is known,

original: vācārambhaṇaṃ vikāro nāmadheyaṃ mṛttikety eva satyam // / / //
analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇam vikāraḥ nāmadheyam mṛttikā iti eva satyam
translated: its name being due to the verbal expression, the modification being a mere word; the truth is this - it is clay.

original: yathā somyaikena lohamaṇinā sarvaṃ lohamayaṃ vijñātaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yathā somya ekena loha maṇinā sarvam loha mayam vijñātam syāt
translated: Just as, my dear, by one gold coin all that is made of gold is known,

original: vācārambhaṇaṃ vikāro nāmadheyaṃ loham ity eva satyam // / / //
analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇam vikāraḥ nāmadheyam loham iti eva satyam
translated: its name being due to the verbal expression, the modification being a mere word; the truth is this - it is gold.

original: yathā somyaikena nakhanikṛntanena sarvaṃ kārṣṇāyasaṃ vijñātaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yathā somya ekena nakha nikṛntanena sarvam kārṣṇāyasam vijñātam syāt
translated: Just as, my dear, by one nail-cutter all that is made of iron is known,

original: vācārambhaṇaṃ vikāro nāmadheyaṃ kṛṣṇāyasam ity eva satyam /
analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇam vikāraḥ nāmadheyam kṛṣṇāyasam iti eva satyam
translated: its name being due to the verbal expression, the modification being a mere word; the truth is this - it is iron.

analyzed: evam somya saḥ ādeśaḥ bhavati iti
translated: Thus, my dear, is that instruction.

original: na vai nūnaṃ bhagavantas ta etad avediṣuḥ /
analyzed: na vai nūnam bhagavantaḥ te etat avediṣuḥ
translated: Surely, revered sirs, they did not know that.

original: yad dhy etad avediṣyan kathaṃ me nāvakṣyan /🔽iti bhagavāṃs tv eva me bravītv iti /
analyzed: yat hi etat avediṣyan katham me na avakṣyan  iti bhagavān tu eva me bravītu iti
translated: For if I had not known this, how could I have told you?🔽Therefore, O revered one, please tell me this.'

original: tathā somyeti hovāca // / / //🔽sad eva somyedam agra āsīd ekam evādvitīyam /
analyzed: tathā somya iti ha uvāca  sat eva somya idam agre āsīt ekam eva advitīyam
translated: 'So be it, my boy,' he said.🔽'In the beginning, my boy, this was Being only, one only, without a second.

original: tad dhaika āhur asad evedam agra āsīd ekam evādvitīyam /
analyzed: tat ha eke āhuḥ asat eva idam agre āsīt ekam eva advitīyam
translated: Some say that in the beginning this was Non-being only, one only, without a second.

analyzed: tasmāt asataḥ sat jāyata
translated: From that Non-being Being was born.'

original: kutas tu khalu somyaivaṃ syād iti hovāca /
analyzed: kutas tu khalu somya evam syāt iti ha uvāca
translated: 'But how could this be, my boy?' he said.

analyzed: katham asataḥ sat jāyeta
translated: 'How could Being be born from Non-being?

original: sat tv eva somyedam agra āsīd ekam evādvitīyam // / / //
analyzed: sat tu eva somya idam agre āsīt ekam eva advitīyam
translated: 'But, my boy, this was Being only in the beginning, one only, without a second.'

analyzed: tat aikṣata
translated: 'It thought:

analyzed: bahu syām prajāyeya iti  tat tejaḥ sṛjata
translated: Let me be many. Let me procreate.🔽It emitted heat.

analyzed: tat tejaḥ aikṣata
translated: That heat thought:

analyzed: bahu syām prajāyeya iti
translated: Let me be many. Let me procreate.

analyzed: tat apaḥ sṛjata
translated: It emitted water.

original: tasmād yatra kva ca śocati svedate vā puruṣas tejasa eva tad adhy āpo jāyante // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt yatra kva ca śocati svedate vā puruṣaḥ tejasaḥ eva tat adhi āpaḥ jāyante
translated: Therefore, wherever a person is heated or perspires, water is born from heat alone.

original: teṣāṃ khalv eṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ trīṇy eva bījāni bhavanty āṇḍajaṃ jīvajam udbhijjam iti // / / //
analyzed: teṣām khalu eṣām bhūtānām trīṇi eva bījāni bhavanti āṇḍa jam jīva jam udbhijjam iti
translated: Of these beings, there are only three sources: born from eggs, born from wombs, and born from sprouts.

analyzed: sā iyam devatā aikṣata
translated: This deity thought:

original: hantāham imās tisro devatā anena jīvenātmanānupraviśya nāmarūpe vyākaravāṇīti // / / //
analyzed: hanta aham imāḥ tisraḥ devatāḥ anena jīvena ātmanā anupraviśya nāma rūpe vyākaravāṇi iti
translated: 'Let me, having entered these three deities with this living soul of mine, evolve names and forms.'

analyzed: tāsām trivṛtam trivṛtam ekaikām karavāṇi iti
translated: 'Let me make each of them threefold.'

original: seyaṃ devatemās tisro devatā anenaiva jīvenātmanānupraviśya nāmarūpe vyākarot // / / //
analyzed: sā iyam devatā imāḥ tisraḥ devatāḥ anena eva jīvena ātmanā anupraviśya nāma rūpe vyākarot
translated: Then that deity, having entered these three deities with this very living soul of itself, evolved names and forms.

analyzed: tāsām trivṛtam trivṛtam ekaikām akarot
translated: It made each of them threefold.

original: yathā tu khalu somyemās tisro devatās trivṛt trivṛd ekaikā bhavati tan me vijānīhīti // / / //
analyzed: yathā tu khalu somya imāḥ tisraḥ devatāḥ trivṛt trivṛt ekaikā bhavati tat me vijānīhi iti
translated: 'But, my dear, how each of these three deities becomes threefold, that you must learn from me.'

original: yad agne rohitaṃ rūpaṃ tejasas tad rūpam /
analyzed: yat agneḥ rohitam rūpam tejasaḥ tat rūpam
translated: 'The red form of Agni is the form of fire.

analyzed: yat śuklam tat apām
translated: The white is of water.

analyzed: yat kṛṣṇam tat annasya
translated: The black is of food.

analyzed: apāgāt agneḥ agni tvam
translated: The divinity of Agni has departed from Agni.

original: vācārambhaṇaṃ vikāro nāmadheyaṃ trīṇi rūpāṇīty eva satyam // / / //
analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇam vikāraḥ nāmadheyam trīṇi rūpāṇi iti eva satyam
translated: Speech is the mere beginning, modification is the name, the three forms are the only truth.'

original: yad ādityasya rohitaṃ rūpaṃ tejasas tad rūpam /
analyzed: yat ādityasya rohitam rūpam tejasaḥ tat rūpam
translated: 'The red form of the sun is the form of fire.

analyzed: yat śuklam tat apām
translated: The white is of water.

analyzed: yat kṛṣṇam tat annasya
translated: The black is of food.

analyzed: apāgāt ādityāt āditya tvam
translated: The divinity of the sun has departed from the sun.

original: vācārambhaṇaṃ vikāro nāmadheyaṃ trīṇi rūpāṇīty eva satyam // / / //🔽yac candramaso rohitaṃ rūpaṃ tejasas tad rūpam /
analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇam vikāraḥ nāmadheyam trīṇi rūpāṇi iti eva satyam  yat candramasaḥ rohitam rūpam tejasaḥ tat rūpam
translated: The modification is a mere verbal designation, the three forms are alone real.🔽And the red form of the moon, that is the form of fire.

analyzed: yat śuklam tat apām
translated: That which is white, that is of water.

analyzed: yat kṛṣṇam tat annasya
translated: That which is black, that is of food.

analyzed: apāgāt candrāt candra tvam
translated: The moon has departed from the moonness.

original: vācārambhaṇaṃ vikāro nāmadheyaṃ trīṇi rūpāṇīty eva satyam // / / //
analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇam vikāraḥ nāmadheyam trīṇi rūpāṇi iti eva satyam
translated: The modification is a mere verbal designation, the three forms are alone real.

original: yad vidyuto rohitaṃ rūpaṃ tejasas tad rūpam /
analyzed: yat vidyutaḥ rohitam rūpam tejasaḥ tat rūpam
translated: That which is the red form of lightning, that is the form of fire.

analyzed: yat śuklam tat apām
translated: That which is white, that is of water.

analyzed: yat kṛṣṇam tat annasya
translated: That which is black, that is of food.

analyzed: apāgāt vidyutaḥ vidyut tvam
translated: Lightning has departed from the lightningness.

original: vācārambhaṇaṃ vikāro nāmadheyaṃ trīṇi rūpāṇīty eva satyam // / / //
analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇam vikāraḥ nāmadheyam trīṇi rūpāṇi iti eva satyam
translated: The modification is a mere verbal designation, the three forms are alone real.

original: etad dha sma vai tadvidvāṃsa āhuḥ pūrve mahāśālā mahāśrotriyāḥ /
analyzed: etat ha sma vai tad vidvāṃsaḥ āhuḥ pūrve mahā śālāḥ mahā śrotriyāḥ
translated: And they, the ancient great householders and great Vedic scholars, who knew this, said:

original: na no 'dya kaścanāśrutam amatam avijñātam udāhariṣyati /
analyzed: na naḥ dya kaścana a śrutam a matam a vijñātam udāhariṣyati
translated: No one will today quote to us anything unheard, unknown, or unrecognized.

analyzed: iti hi ebhyaḥ vidām cakruḥ
translated: For from them they made the knowers.

original: yad u rohitam ivābhūd iti tejasas tad rūpam iti tad vidāṃ cakruḥ /
analyzed: yat u rohitam iva abhūt iti tejasaḥ tat rūpam iti tat vidām cakruḥ
translated: That which appeared as if red, that is the form of fire, thus they made the knowers.

original: yad u śuklam ivābhūd ity apāṃ rūpam iti tad vidāṃ cakruḥ /
analyzed: yat u śuklam iva abhūt iti apām rūpam iti tat vidām cakruḥ
translated: What appeared to be white, they knew to be the form of water.

original: yad u kṛṣṇam ivābhūd ity annasya rūpam iti tad vidāṃ cakruḥ // / / //
analyzed: yat u kṛṣṇam iva abhūt iti annasya rūpam iti tat vidām cakruḥ
translated: What appeared to be black, they knew to be the form of food.

original: yad v avijñātam ivābhūd ity etāsām eva devatānāṃ samāsa iti tad vidāṃ cakruḥ /
analyzed: yat u a vijñātam iva abhūt iti etāsām eva devatānām samāsaḥ iti tat vidām cakruḥ
translated: What appeared to be unknown, they knew to be the combination of those very deities.

original: yathā nu khalu somyemās tisro devatāḥ puruṣaṃ prāpya trivṛt trivṛd ekaikā bhavati tan me vijānīhīti // / / //
analyzed: yathā nu khalu somya imāḥ tisraḥ devatāḥ puruṣam prāpya trivṛt trivṛt ekaikā bhavati tat me vijānīhi iti
translated: Now, my dear, how these three deities, having reached a person, become threefold each, you know that.

analyzed: annam aśitam tredhā vidhīyate
translated: Food eaten is divided into three parts.

original: tasya yaḥ sthaviṣṭho dhātus tat purīṣaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tasya yaḥ sthaviṣṭhaḥ dhātuḥ tat purīṣam bhavati
translated: Of that, the coarsest part becomes feces.

analyzed: yaḥ madhyamaḥ tat māṃsam
translated: The middle part becomes flesh.

analyzed: yaḥ ṇiṣṭhaḥ tat manaḥ
translated: The subtlest part becomes mind.

original: āpaḥ pītās tredhā vidhīyante /🔽tāsāṃ yaḥ sthaviṣṭho dhātus tan mūtraṃ bhavati /🔽yo madhyamas tal lohitam /
analyzed: āpaḥ pītāḥ tredhā vidhīyante  tāsām yaḥ sthaviṣṭhaḥ dhātuḥ tat mūtram bhavati  yaḥ madhyamaḥ tat lohitam
translated: Water drunk is divided into three parts.🔽Of those, the coarsest part becomes urine.🔽The middle part becomes blood.

analyzed: yaḥ ṇiṣṭhaḥ sa prāṇaḥ
translated: The subtlest part becomes breath.

analyzed: tejaḥ śitam tredhā vidhīyate
translated: Fire eaten is divided into three parts.

original: tasya yaḥ sthaviṣṭho dhātus tad asthi bhavati /
analyzed: tasya yaḥ sthaviṣṭhaḥ dhātuḥ tat asthi bhavati
translated: Of that, the coarsest part becomes bone.

analyzed: yaḥ madhyamaḥ sa majjā
translated: The middle part becomes marrow.

analyzed: yaḥ ṇiṣṭhaḥ sā vāc
translated: The subtlest of these is speech.

analyzed: anna mayam hi somya manaḥ  āpaḥ mayaḥ prāṇaḥ
translated: For, my dear, the mind consists of food.🔽The lifebreath consists of water.

analyzed: tejaḥ mayī vāc iti
translated: Speech consists of fire.

original: bhūya eva mā bhagavān vijñāpayatv iti /
analyzed: bhūyas eva mā bhagavān vijñāpayatu iti
translated: Please explain this to me again, sir.

analyzed: tathā somya iti ha uvāca
translated: So be it, my dear, he said.

original: dadhnaḥ somya mathyamānasya yo 'ṇimā sa ūrdhvaḥ samudīṣati /
analyzed: dadhnaḥ somya mathyamānasya yaḥ ṇimā saḥ ūrdhvaḥ samudīṣati
translated: When curds are churned, my dear, the subtlest part rises upwards.

analyzed: tat sarpiḥ bhavati
translated: That becomes ghee.

original: evam eva khalu somyānnasyāśyamānasya yo 'ṇimā sa ūrdhvaḥ samudīṣati /
analyzed: evam eva khalu somya annasya aśyamānasya yaḥ ṇimā saḥ ūrdhvaḥ samudīṣati
translated: In the same way, my dear, when food is eaten, the subtlest part rises upwards.

analyzed: tat manaḥ bhavati
translated: That becomes the mind.

original: apāṃ somya pīyamānānāṃ yo 'ṇimā sa ūrdhvaḥ samudīṣati /
analyzed: apām somya pīyamānānām yaḥ ṇimā saḥ ūrdhvaḥ samudīṣati
translated: When water is drunk, my dear, the subtlest part rises upwards.

analyzed: sā prānaḥ bhavati
translated: That becomes the lifebreath.

original: tejasaḥ somyāśyamānasya yo 'ṇimā sa ūrdhvaḥ samudīṣati /
analyzed: tejasaḥ somya aśyamānasya yaḥ ṇimā saḥ ūrdhvaḥ samudīṣati
translated: When fire is eaten, my dear, the subtlest part rises upwards.

analyzed: sā vāc bhavati
translated: That becomes speech.

analyzed: anna mayam hi somya manaḥ  āpaḥ mayaḥ prāṇaḥ
translated: For, my dear, the mind consists of food.🔽The lifebreath consists of water.

analyzed: tejaḥ mayī vāc iti
translated: Speech consists of fire.

original: bhūya eva mā bhagavān vijñāpayatv iti /
analyzed: bhūyas eva mā bhagavān vijñāpayatu iti
translated: Please explain this to me again, sir.

analyzed: tathā somya iti ha uvāca
translated: So be it, my dear, he said.

analyzed: ṣoḍaśa kalaḥ somya puruṣaḥ
translated: The person consists of sixteen parts, my dear.

analyzed: pañcadaśa ahāni mā aśīḥ
translated: Do not eat for fifteen days.

analyzed: kāmam apaḥ piba
translated: Drink water as you like.

original: āpomayaḥ prāṇo na pibato vicchetsyata iti // / / //
analyzed: āpaḥ mayaḥ prāṇaḥ na pibataḥ vicchetsyate iti
translated: 'The life-breath is composed of water; if one does not drink, it would be cut off.'

analyzed: sa ha pañcadaśa ahāni na āśa
translated: He (Uddalaka) lost his senses for fifteen days.

original: atha hainam upasasāda kiṃ bravīmi bho iti /
analyzed: atha ha enam upasasāda kim bravīmi bho iti
translated: Then he approached him (his son) and said, 'What shall I say, sir?'

analyzed: ṛcaḥ somya yajūṃṣi sāmāni iti
translated: 'The Ṛg verses, O dear one, the Yajur mantras, the Sāman chants.'

original: sa hovāca na vai mā pratibhānti bho iti // / / //
analyzed: sa ha uvāca na vai mā pratibhānti bho iti
translated: He said, 'They do not appear to me, sir.'

original: taṃ hovāca yathā somya mahato 'bhyāhitasyaiko 'ṅgāraḥ khadyotamātraḥ pariśiṣṭaḥ syāt /

analyzed: tat ha asya vijajñau iti vijajñau iti

analyzed: yatra etat puruṣaḥ svapiti nāma satā somya tadā saṃpannaḥ bhavati

analyzed: svam api itas bhavati

analyzed: tasmāt enam svapiti iti ācakṣate

analyzed: svam hi api itas bhavati
translated: for he goes to his own.

analyzed: evam eva khalu somya tat manaḥ diśam diśam patitvā anyatra āyatanam a labdhvā prāṇam eva upaśrayate
translated: in the same way, my dear, that mind, flying in all directions, not finding a place to rest elsewhere, rests on the very lifebreath.

analyzed: prāṇa bandhanam hi somya manaḥ iti

analyzed: aśanā pipāse me somya vijānīhi iti

original: yatraitat puruṣo 'śiśiṣati nāmāpa eva tad aśitaṃ nayante /

translated: Where a man desires to eat, then the water carries that food.

original: tad yathā gonāyo 'śvanāyaḥ puruṣanāya ity evaṃ tad apa ācakṣate 'śanāyeti /

analyzed: tatra etat śuṅgam utpatitam somya vijānīhi
translated: There, my dear, you should understand that this shoot has sprung up.

analyzed: na idam amūlam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: It will not be without a root, my dear.

analyzed: tasya kva mūlam syāt anyatra annāt
translated: Where, my dear, could it have a root, if not in food?

original: evam eva khalu somyānnena śuṅgenāpo mūlam anviccha /🔽adbhiḥ somya śuṅgena tejo mūlam anviccha /
analyzed: evam eva khalu somya annena śuṅgena apaḥ mūlam anviccha  adbhiḥ somya śuṅgena tejaḥ mūlam anviccha
translated: In the same way, my dear, through this shoot of food, seek for the root, water.🔽Through this shoot of water, my dear, seek for the root, fire.

analyzed: tejasā somya śuṅgena sat mūlam anviccha

original: sanmūlāḥ somyemāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ sadāyatanāḥ satpratiṣṭhāḥ // / / //

translated: There, my dear, you should understand that this very shoot has sprung up.

analyzed: na idam amūlam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: It will not be without a root, my dear.

analyzed: tasya kva mūlam syāt anyatra adbhyaḥ
translated: Where, my dear, could it have a root, if not in water?

original: adbhiḥ somya śuṅgena tejo mūlam anviccha /

translated: With water, my dear, as the probe, seek the root of heat.

analyzed: tejasā somya śuṅgena sat mūlam anviccha
translated: With heat, my dear, as the probe, seek the root of Being.

original: sanmūlāḥ somyemāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ sad āyatanāḥ satpratiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: sat mūlāḥ somya imāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ sat āyatanāḥ sat pratiṣṭhāḥ
translated: My dear, all these beings have their root in Being, their abode in Being, their support in Being.

translated: Just as, my dear, one might bring a man from the Gandhāras with his eyes bound, and let him go there among the people,

analyzed: sa yathā tatra prāṅ vā udaṅ vā adharāṅ vā pratyaṅ vā ānītaḥ bhinaddha akṣaḥ visṛṣṭaḥ
translated: and as he would blow there either east, north, south, or west, with his eyes bound, brought, with his eyes bound, let go,

original: tasya yathābhinahanaṃ pramucya prabrūyād etāṃ diśaṃ gandhārā etāṃ diśaṃ vrajeti /
analyzed: tasya yathā abhinahanam pramucya prabrūyāt etām diśam gandhārāḥ etām diśam vraja iti
translated: and someone, having released his binding, would tell him, 'This way are the Gandhāras, this way you should go,'

original: sa grāmād grāmaṃ pṛcchan paṇḍito medhāvī gandhārān evopasaṃpadyeta /
analyzed: sa grāmāt grāmam pṛcchan paṇḍitaḥ medhāvī gandhārān eva upasaṃpadyeta
translated: and he, asking from village to village, being learned, intelligent, would reach the Gandhāras alone.

analyzed: evam eva iha ācāryavān puruṣaḥ veda
translated: In the same way, here, a person with a teacher knows.

original: tasya tāvad eva ciraṃ yāvan na vimokṣye 'tha saṃpatsya iti // / / //
analyzed: tasya tāvat eva ciram yāvat na vimokṣye saṃpatsye iti
translated: For him it is a long time only as long as he is not released, then he will be successful.

original: sa ya eṣo 'ṇimaitad ātmyam idaṃ sarvam /
analyzed: sa yaḥ eṣaḥ ṇimā etat ātmyam idam sarvam
translated: That which is the smallest here, that is the self, that is all this.

analyzed: tat satyam
translated: That is truth.

analyzed: saḥ ātmā
translated: That is the self.

analyzed: tat tvam asi śvetaketo iti
translated: You are that, Śvetaketu.

original: bhūya eva mā bhagavān vijñāpayatv iti /
analyzed: bhūyas eva mā bhagavān vijñāpayatu iti
translated: Please, sir, explain it to me again.

analyzed: tathā somya iti ha uvāca
translated: He said, So, my dear.🔽 Just as, my dear, one might take a piece of salt,🔽and put it in water,🔽and a bird would drink it with its beak, thinking it is water,🔽and would return to its nest, thinking it is water.

original: puruṣaṃ somyotopatāpinaṃ jñātayaḥ paryupāsate jānāsi māṃ jānāsi mām iti /
analyzed: puruṣam somya uta upatāpinam jñātayaḥ paryupāsate jānāsi mām jānāsi mām iti
translated: When a man is being heated, O Somya, his relatives sit around him and say, You know me, you know me.

original: tasya yāvan na vāṅ manasi saṃpadyate manaḥ prāṇe prāṇas tejasi tejaḥ parasyāṃ devatāyāṃ tāvaj jānāti // / / //
analyzed: tasya yāvat na vāc manasi saṃpadyate manaḥ prāṇe prāṇaḥ tejasi tejaḥ parasyām devatāyām tāvat jānāti
translated: As long as his speech does not merge into the mind, the mind into the life-breath, the life-breath into the heat, and the heat into the supreme deity, he knows.

original: atha yadāsya vāṅ manasi saṃpadyate manaḥ prāṇe prāṇas tejasi tejaḥ parasyāṃ devatāyām atha na jānāti // / / //
analyzed: atha yadā asya vāc manasi saṃpadyate manaḥ prāṇe prāṇaḥ tejasi tejaḥ parasyām devatāyām atha na jānāti
translated: But when his speech merges into the mind, the mind into the life-breath, the life-breath into the heat, and the heat into the supreme deity, then he does not know.

original: sa ya eṣo 'ṇimaitad ātmyam idaṃ sarvam /
analyzed: sa yaḥ eṣaḥ ṇimā etat ātmyam idam sarvam
translated: That which is the subtlest here, that is the Self, that is to be known, that is the supreme.

analyzed: tat satyam
translated: That is the truth.

analyzed: saḥ ātmā
translated: That is the Self.

analyzed: tat tvam asi śvetaketo iti
translated: You are that, O Śvetaketu.

original: bhūya eva mā bhagavān vijñāpayatv iti /
analyzed: bhūyas eva mā bhagavān vijñāpayatu iti
translated: Please explain it to me again, revered sir.

analyzed: tathā somya iti ha uvāca
translated: So be it, O Somya, he said.

analyzed: puruṣam somya uta hasta gṛhītam ānayanti
translated: O Somya, they bring a man who is seized by the hand,

original: apahārṣīt steyam akārṣīt paraśum asmai tapateti /
analyzed: apahārṣīt steyam akārṣīt paraśum asmai tapata iti
translated: saying, He has stolen! He has committed theft! The axe burns for him!

original: sa yadi tasya kartā bhavati tata evānṛtam ātmānaṃ kurute /
analyzed: sa yadi tasya kartā bhavati tatas eva anṛtam ātmānam kurute
translated: If he is the doer of that, then he makes himself a liar.

analyzed: saḥ nṛtā abhisaṃdhaḥ nṛtena ātmānam antardhāya paraśum taptam pratigṛhṇāti
translated: That one who is resolved on untruth, having concealed himself by untruth, grasps the burning axe.

analyzed: sa dahyate
translated: He is burned.

analyzed: atha hanyate
translated: Then he is killed.

analyzed: atha yadi tasya akartā bhavati
translated: Now, if he becomes the doer of that,

analyzed: tatas eva satyam ātmānam kurute
translated: then he makes himself true from that very [act].

original: sa satyābhisandhaḥ satyenātmānam antardhāya paraśuṃ taptaṃ pratigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: sa satya abhisandhaḥ satyena ātmānam antardhāya paraśum taptam pratigṛhṇāti
translated: United with truth, having concealed himself with truth, he receives a heated axe.

analyzed: sa na dahyate
translated: He is not burned.

analyzed: atha mucyate
translated: Then he is released.

analyzed: sa yathā tatra na ādāhyeta
translated: As he would not be burned there,

analyzed: etat ātmyam idam sarvam
translated: this is the essence of all this.

analyzed: tat satyam
translated: That is truth.

analyzed: saḥ ātmā
translated: That is the Self.

analyzed: tat tvam asi śvetaketo iti
translated: You are that, Śvetaketu.

original: tad dhāsya vijajñāv iti vijajñāv iti // / / //
analyzed: tat ha asya vijajñau iti vijajñau iti
translated: Then he understood that. He understood that.

original: adhīhi bhagava iti hopasasāda sanatkumāraṃ nāradaḥ /
analyzed: adhīhi bhagavaḥ iti ha upasasāda sanatkumāram nāradaḥ
translated: Narada approached Sanatkumara, saying, Venerable sir, teach me.

original: taṃ hovāca yad vettha tena mopasīda /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca yat vettha tena mā upasīda
translated: He said to him, Approach me with what you know.

analyzed: tatas te ūrdhvam vakṣyāmi iti
translated: Then I will tell you what is beyond that.

analyzed: sa ha uvāca
translated: He said,

original: ṛgvedaṃ bhagavo 'dhyemi yajurvedaṃ sāmavedam ātharvaṇaṃ caturtham itihāsapurāṇaṃ
analyzed: ṛgvedam bhagavaḥ dhyemi yajurvedam sāmavedam ātharvaṇam caturtham itihāsa purāṇam
translated: Venerable sir, I study the Rig Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sama Veda, the Atharva Veda as the fourth, the Itihasa and Purana,

original: pañcamaṃ vedānāṃ vedaṃ pitryaṃ rāśiṃ daivaṃ nidhiṃ vākovākyam ekāyanaṃ devavidyāṃ
analyzed: pañcamam vedānām vedam pitryam rāśim daivam nidhim vākovākyam ekāyanam deva vidyām
translated: the fifth Veda of the Vedas, the science of genealogy, the science of omens, the science of treasures, the science of logic, the science of one path, the knowledge of the gods,

original: brahmavidyāṃ bhūtavidyāṃ kṣatravidyāṃ nakṣatravidyāṃ sarpadevajanavidyām etad bhagavo
analyzed: brahma vidyām bhūta vidyām kṣatra vidyām nakṣatra vidyām sarpa deva jana vidyām etat bhagavaḥ
translated: the knowledge of Brahman, the knowledge of beings, the knowledge of the warrior class, the knowledge of the stars, the knowledge of serpents and gods - this, venerable sir,

analyzed: dhyemi
translated: I study.

analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavaḥ mantra vid eva asmi na ātma vid
translated: I, O revered sir, am one who knows the formulas, but not one who knows the self.

original: śrutaṃ hy eva me bhagavaddṛśebhyas tarati śokam ātmavid iti /
analyzed: śrutam hi eva me bhagavat dṛśebhyaḥ tarati śokam ātma vid iti
translated: For I have heard from those who have seen the revered one that one who knows the self crosses over sorrow.

analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavaḥ śocāmi
translated: I, O revered sir, am sorrowful.

original: taṃ mā bhagavāñ chokasya pāraṃ tārayatv iti /
analyzed: tam mā bhagavān śokasya pāram tārayatu iti
translated: May the revered one lead me across to the other side of sorrow.

original: taṃ hovāca yad vai kiṃcaitad adhyagīṣṭhā nāmaivaitat // / / //
analyzed: tam ha uvāca yat vai kiṃca etat adhyagīṣṭhāḥ nāma eva etat
translated: He said to him: Whatever this is that you have studied, that is indeed just the name.

original: nāma vā ṛgvedo yajurvedaḥ sāmaveda ātharvaṇaś caturtha itihāsapurāṇaḥ pañcamo vedānāṃ
analyzed: nāma vai ṛgvedaḥ yajurvedaḥ sāmavedaḥ ātharvaṇaḥ caturthaḥ itihāsa purāṇaḥ pañcamaḥ vedānām
translated: The name is the Ṛg Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sāma Veda, the Atharva Veda as the fourth, the Itihāsa and Purāṇa as the fifth of the Vedas,

original: vedaḥ pitryo rāśir daivo nidhir vākovākyam ekāyanaṃ devavidyā brahmavidyā bhūtavidyā
analyzed: vedaḥ pitryaḥ rāśiḥ daivaḥ nidhiḥ vākovākyam ekāyanam deva vidyā brahma vidyā bhūta vidyā
translated: the Veda of the ancestors, the collection, the divine treasure, the sayings of the sages, the one path, the knowledge of the gods, the knowledge of Brahman, the knowledge of beings,

analyzed: kṣatra vidyā nakṣatra vidyā sarpa deva jana vidyā
translated: the knowledge of the warrior class, the knowledge of the stars, the knowledge of serpents, gods, and people.

analyzed: nāma eva etat
translated: That is indeed just the name.

analyzed: nāma upāssva iti  sa yaḥ nāma brahma iti upāste
translated: Worship the name.🔽One who worships the name as Brahman

original: yāvan nāmno gataṃ tatrāsya yathākāmacāro bhavati yo nāma brahmety upāste /
analyzed: yāvat nāmnaḥ gatam tatra asya yathākāma cāraḥ bhavati yaḥ nāma brahma iti upāste
translated: has freedom to go as far as the name goes, one who worships the name as Brahman.

analyzed: asti bhagavaḥ nāmnaḥ bhūyaḥ iti
translated: Is there anything greater than name, revered sir?

analyzed: nāmnaḥ vāva bhūyaḥ sti iti
translated: Name indeed is greater.

analyzed: tat me bhagavān bravītu iti
translated: May the revered one tell me that.

analyzed: vāc vāva nāmnaḥ bhūyasī
translated: Speech, verily, is greater than name.

original: vāg vā ṛgvedaṃ vijñāpayati yajurvedaṃ sāmavedam ātharvaṇaṃ caturtham itihāsapurāṇaṃ
analyzed: vāc vai ṛgvedam vijñāpayati yajurvedam sāmavedam ātharvaṇam caturtham itihāsa purāṇam
translated: Speech makes known the Ṛg Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sāma Veda, the fourth Atharva Veda, the Itihāsa-Purāṇa,

original: pañcamaṃ vedānāṃ vedaṃ pitryaṃ rāśiṃ daivaṃ nidhiṃ vākovākyam ekāyanaṃ devavidyāṃ
analyzed: pañcamam vedānām vedam pitryam rāśim daivam nidhim vākovākyam ekāyanam deva vidyām
translated: the fifth Veda of the Vedas, the science of ancestors, the science of stars, the science of treasures, the science of speech, the science of one path, the science of gods,

original: brahmavidyāṃ bhūtavidyāṃ kṣatravidyāṃ nakṣatravidyāṃ sarpadevajanavidyāṃ divaṃ ca
analyzed: brahma vidyām bhūta vidyām kṣatra vidyām nakṣatra vidyām sarpa deva jana vidyām divam ca
translated: the science of Brahman, the science of beings, the science of warriors, the science of stars, the science of serpents and gods, heaven

original: pṛthivīṃ ca vāyuṃ cākāśaṃ cāpaś ca tejaś ca devāṃś ca manuṣyāṃś ca paśūṃś ca vayāṃsi
analyzed: pṛthivīm ca vāyum ca ākāśam ca āpaḥ ca tejaḥ ca devān ca manuṣyān ca paśūn ca vayāṃsi
translated: and earth, wind and space, water and fire, gods and men, cattle and birds,

original: ca tṛṇavanaspatīñ śvāpadāny ākīṭapataṅgapipīlakaṃ dharmaṃ cādharmaṃ /
analyzed: ca tṛṇa vanaspatīm śvāpadāni ā kīṭa pataṅga pipīlakam dharmam ca adharmam
translated: and grass and trees, wild animals, insects, moths and ants, dharma and adharma,

original: ca satyaṃ cānṛtaṃ ca sādhu cāsādhu ca hṛdayajñaṃ cāhṛdayajñaṃ ca /
analyzed: ca satyam ca anṛtam ca sādhu ca asādhu ca hṛdayajñam ca a hṛdayajñam ca
translated: truth and falsehood, good and bad, what is pleasing to the heart and what is not pleasing to the heart.

original: yad vai vāṅ nābhaviṣyan na dharmo nādharmo vyajñāpayiṣyan na satyaṃ nānṛtaṃ na sādhu nāsādhu na hṛdayajño nāhṛdayajñaḥ /
analyzed: yat vai vāc na abhaviṣyat na dharmaḥ na adharmaḥ vyajñāpayiṣyat na satyam na anṛtam na sādhu na asādhu na hṛdaya jñaḥ na a hṛdaya jñaḥ
translated: If there were no speech, dharma and adharma would not be made known, truth and falsehood, good and bad, what is pleasing to the heart and what is not pleasing to the heart.

original: vāg evaitad sarvaṃ vijñāpayati vācam upāssveti // / / //
analyzed: vāc eva etat sarvam vijñāpayati vācam upāssva iti
translated: Speech makes known all this. Worship speech.

analyzed: sa yaḥ vācam brahma iti upāste
translated: He who worships speech as Brahman,

original: yāvad vāco gataṃ tatrāsya yathākāmacāro bhavati yo vācaṃ brahmety upāste /
analyzed: yāvat vācaḥ gatam tatra asya yathākāma cāraḥ bhavati yaḥ vācam brahma iti upāste
translated: As far as speech has gone, he has power to go as far as he wills, who worships speech as Brahman.

analyzed: asti bhagavaḥ vācaḥ bhūyaḥ iti
translated: 'Is there anything greater than speech, revered sir?'

analyzed: vācaḥ vāva bhūyaḥ sti iti
translated: 'Surely, speech is greater.'

analyzed: tat me bhagavān bravītu iti
translated: 'May the revered one explain that to me.'

analyzed: manaḥ vāva vācaḥ bhūyaḥ
translated: 'Mind, verily, is greater than speech.

original: yathā vai dve vāmalake dve vā kole dvau vākṣau muṣṭir anubhavaty evaṃ vācaṃ ca nāma ca mano 'nubhavati /
analyzed: yathā vai dve vā āmalake dve vā kole dvau vā akṣau muṣṭiḥ anubhavati evam vācam ca nāma ca manaḥ nubhavati
translated: Just as a fist experiences two myrobalans or two jujubes or two eyes, so mind experiences speech and name.

original: sa yadā manasā manasyati mantrān adhīyīyety athādhīte /
analyzed: sa yadā manasā manasyati mantrān adhīyīya iti atha adhīte
translated: When he mentally intends, I will study the mantras, then he studies.

analyzed: karmāṇi kurvīya iti atha kurute
translated: I will perform rites, then he performs.

analyzed: putrān ca paśūn ca iccheya iti atha icchate
translated: I will desire sons and cattle, then he desires.

original: imaṃ ca lokam amuṃ ceccheyety athecchate /
analyzed: imam ca lokam amum ca iccheya iti atha icchate
translated: I will desire this world and the next, then he desires.

analyzed: manaḥ hi ātmā
translated: For the mind is the self.

analyzed: manaḥ hi lokaḥ
translated: The mind is the world.

analyzed: manaḥ hi brahma
translated: The mind is Brahman.

original: mana upāssveti // / / //🔽sa yo mano brahmety upāste /
analyzed: manaḥ upāssva iti  sa yaḥ manaḥ brahma iti upāste
translated: Meditate on the mind.'🔽He who worships the mind as Brahman

original: yāvan manaso gataṃ tatrāsya yathākāmacāro bhavati yo mano brahmety upāste /
analyzed: yāvat manasaḥ gatam tatra asya yathākāma cāraḥ bhavati yaḥ manaḥ brahma iti upāste
translated: as far as the mind has gone, he has power to go as far as he wills, who worships the mind as Brahman.

analyzed: asti bhagavaḥ manasaḥ bhūyaḥ iti
translated: 'Is there anything greater than mind, revered sir?'

analyzed: manasaḥ vāva bhūyaḥ sti iti
translated: 'Surely, there is something greater than mind.'

original: tan me bhagavān bravītv iti // / / //🔽saṃkalpo vāva manaso bhūyān /
analyzed: tat me bhagavān bravītu iti  saṃkalpaḥ vāva manasaḥ bhūyān
translated: May the Blessed One tell that to me.🔽Indeed, resolve is greater than mind.

analyzed: yadā vai saṃkalpayate manasyati
translated: When one resolves, then one thinks with the mind.

analyzed: atha vācam īrayati
translated: Then one utters speech.

analyzed: tām u nāmni īyūati
translated: One utters it in the name.

analyzed: nāmni mantrāḥ ekam bhavanti
translated: In the name, the mantras become one.

analyzed: mantreṣu karmāṇi
translated: In the mantras, the actions...

original: tāni ha vā etāni saṃkalpaikāyanāni saṃkalpātmakāni saṃkalpe pratiṣṭhitāni /
analyzed: tāni ha vai etāni saṃkalpa ekāyanāni saṃkalpa ātmakāni saṃkalpe pratiṣṭhitāni
translated: Indeed, these are all rooted in resolve, consisting of resolve, established in resolve.

analyzed: samakḷpatām dyāvāpṛthivī  samakalpetām vāyuḥ ca ākāśam ca
translated: Heaven and earth resolved together.🔽Wind and space resolved together.

original: samakalpantāpaś ca tejaś ca /🔽teṣāṃ saṃkḷptyai varṣaṃ saṃkalpate /
analyzed: samakalpanta āpaḥ ca tejaḥ ca  teṣām saṃkḷptyai varṣam saṃkalpate
translated: Water and fire resolved together.🔽For their resolution, rain resolves.

original: varṣasya saṃkḷptyā annaṃ saṃkalpate /🔽annasya saṃkḷptyai prāṇāḥ saṃkalpante /
analyzed: varṣasya saṃkḷptyai annam saṃkalpate  annasya saṃkḷptyai prāṇāḥ saṃkalpante
translated: For the resolution of rain, food resolves.🔽For the resolution of food, the vital breaths resolve.

analyzed: prāṇānām saṃkḷptyai mantrāḥ saṃkalpante
translated: For the resolution of the vital breaths, the mantras resolve.

analyzed: mantrāṇām saṃkḷptyai karmāṇi saṃkalpante
translated: For the resolution of the mantras, the actions resolve.

analyzed: karmaṇām saṃkḷptyai lokaḥ saṃkalpate
translated: For the resolution of the actions, the world resolves.

analyzed: lokasya saṃkḷptyai sarvam saṃkalpate
translated: For the resolution of the world, everything resolves.

analyzed: saḥ eṣa saṃkalpaḥ
translated: That is this resolve.🔽Meditate on resolve.🔽...

analyzed: saṃkalpam upāssva iti
translated: Meditate on the will.

analyzed: sa yaḥ saṃkalpam brahma iti upāste
translated: One who meditates on will as Brahman

original: kḷptān vai sa lokān dhruvān dhruvaḥ pratiṣṭhitān pratiṣṭhito 'vyathamānān avyathamāno 'bhisidhyati /
analyzed: kḷptān vai sa lokān dhruvān dhruvaḥ pratiṣṭhitān pratiṣṭhitaḥ vyathamānān a vyathamānaḥ bhisidhyati
translated: attains worlds that are created, firm, firmly established, unmoving, and uninjured.

original: yāvat saṃkalpasya gataṃ tatrāsya yathākāmacāro bhavati yaḥ saṃkalpaṃ brahmety upāste /
analyzed: yāvat saṃkalpasya gatam tatra asya yathākāma cāraḥ bhavati yaḥ saṃkalpam brahma iti upāste
translated: Wherever will goes, there he has freedom of action, who meditates on will as Brahman.

analyzed: asti bhagavaḥ saṃkalpāt bhūyaḥ iti
translated: 'Is there anything greater than will, revered sir?'

analyzed: saṃkalpāt vāva bhūyaḥ sti iti
translated: 'Will indeed is greater, my dear.'

analyzed: tat me bhagavān bravītu iti
translated: 'Please tell me that, revered sir.'

analyzed: cittam vāva saṃkalpāt bhūyaḥ
translated: 'The mind, indeed, is greater than will.

analyzed: yadā vai cetayate tha saṃkalpayate
translated: For when one thinks, then one wills.

analyzed: atha manasyati
translated: Then one intends.

analyzed: atha vācam īrayati
translated: Then one utters speech.

analyzed: tām u nāmni īyūati
translated: That he directs to names.

analyzed: nāmni mantrāḥ ekam bhavanti
translated: In names, the mantras are one.

analyzed: mantreṣu karmāṇi
translated: In the mantras, the actions are one.

original: tāni ha vā etāni cittaikāyanāni cittātmāni citte pratiṣṭhitāni /
analyzed: tāni ha vai etāni citta ekāyanāni citta ātmāni citte pratiṣṭhitāni
translated: Those, indeed, have the mind as their one abode, the mind as their self, the mind as their support.

original: tasmād yady api bahuvid acitto bhavati nāyam astīty evainam āhuḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt yadi api bahu vid acittaḥ bhavati na ayam asti iti eva enam āhuḥ
translated: Therefore, even if one who knows much becomes mindless, they say of him, 'He does not exist.'

original: yad ayaṃ veda yad vā ayaṃ vidvān nettham acittaḥ syād iti /
analyzed: yat ayam veda yat vai ayam vidvān na ittham acittaḥ syāt iti
translated: 'What he knows, or what he, knowing, would not be mindless in this way.'

translated: This is the self, free from evil, free from old age, free from death, free from grief, free from hunger and thirst, having true desires, having true resolves.
