analyzed: saṃkalpāt eva asya gandha mālye samuttiṣṭhataḥ
translated: by mere thought, perfumes and garlands arise for him.

analyzed: tena gandha mālya lokena saṃpannaḥ mahīyate
translated: Endowed with that world of perfumes and garlands, he becomes great.

original: atha yady annapānalokakāmo bhavati /🔽saṃkalpād evāsyānnapāne samuttiṣṭhataḥ /
analyzed: atha yadi anna pāna loka kāmaḥ bhavati  saṃkalpāt eva asya anna pāne samuttiṣṭhataḥ
translated: Now, if he desires the world of food and drink,🔽by mere thought, food and drink arise for him.

analyzed: tena anna pāna lokena saṃpannaḥ mahīyate
translated: Endowed with that world of food and drink, he becomes great.

analyzed: atha yadi gīta vādita loka kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: Now, if he desires the world of singing and music,

analyzed: saṃkalpāt eva asya gīta vādite samuttiṣṭhataḥ
translated: by mere thought, singing and music arise for him.

analyzed: tena gīta vādita lokena saṃpannaḥ mahīyate
translated: Endowed with that world of singing and music, he becomes great.

analyzed: atha yadi strī loka kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: Now, if he desires the world of women,

analyzed: saṃkalpāt eva asya striyaḥ samuttiṣṭhanti
translated: by mere thought, women arise for him.

analyzed: tena strī lokena saṃpannaḥ mahīyate
translated: Endowed with that world of women, he becomes great.

analyzed: yam yam antam abhikāmaḥ bhavati
translated: Whatever end he desires,

analyzed: yam kāmam kāmayate
translated: whatever desire he desires,

analyzed: saḥ sya saṃkalpāt eva samuttiṣṭhati
translated: that arises for him by mere thought.

analyzed: tena saṃpannaḥ mahīyate
translated: Endowed with that, he becomes great.

analyzed: te ime satyāḥ kāmāḥ anṛta apidhānāḥ
translated: These desires are true, but are covered by the untrue.

analyzed: teṣām satyānām satām anṛtam apidhānam
translated: For these true desires, the untrue is the covering.

original: yo yo hy asyetaḥ praiti na tam iha darśanāya labhate // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ yaḥ hi asya itas praiti na tam iha darśanāya labhate
translated: For whoever departs from here, he is not obtained here for seeing.

original: atha ye cāsyeha jīvā ye ca pretā yac cānyad icchan na labhate sarvaṃ tad atra gatvā vindate /
analyzed: atha ye ca asya iha jīvāḥ ye ca pretāḥ yat ca anyat icchan na labhate sarvam tat atra gatvā vindate
translated: Now, all those who live here, those who are dead, and anything else he desires but does not obtain, having gone there, he obtains all that.

original: atra hy asyaite satyāḥ kāmā anṛtāpidhānāḥ /
analyzed: atra hi asya ete satyāḥ kāmāḥ anṛta apidhānāḥ
translated: For here, these desires of his are true, but are covered by the untrue.

original: tad yathāpi hiraṇyanidhiṃ nihitam akṣetrajñā upary upari sañcaranto na vindeyuḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api hiraṇya nidhim nihitam akṣetrajñāḥ upari upari sañcarantaḥ na vindeyuḥ
translated: Just as a treasure of gold is hidden, and those who walk above it do not find it,

original: evam evemāḥ sarvāḥ prajā ahar ahar gacchantya etaṃ brahmalokaṃ na vindanty anṛtena hi pratyūḍhāḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam eva imāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ ahar ahar gacchantyaḥ etam brahma lokam na vindanti anṛtena hi pratyūḍhāḥ
translated: even so all these beings go day after day to this world of Brahman, but do not find it, for they are carried away by the untrue.

analyzed: sa vai eṣaḥ ātmā hṛdi
translated: That Self is in the heart.

original: tasyaitad eva niruktaṃ hṛdy ayam iti tasmād dhṛd ayam /
analyzed: tasya etat eva niruktam hṛdi ayam iti tasmāt hṛd ayam
translated: Its etymology is this: 'Hridayam' because 'ayam' is hidden in it. Therefore it is 'hrid-ayam'.

original: ahar ahar vā evaṃvit svargaṃ lokam eti // / / //
analyzed: ahar ahar vai evaṃvid svargam lokam eti
translated: Day after day, one who knows thus goes to the heavenly world.

original: atha ya eṣa saṃprasādo 'smāc charīrāt samutthāya paraṃ jyotir upasaṃpadya svena rūpenābhiniṣpadyata eṣa ātmeti hovāca /
analyzed: atha yaḥ eṣa saṃprasādaḥ u smāt śarīrāt samutthāya param jyotiḥ upasaṃpadya svena rūpena abhiniṣpadyate eṣaḥ ātmā iti ha uvāca
translated: Now, he who, having risen from this body, having attained the supreme light, having become manifest in his own form, is this Self, he said.

analyzed: etat amṛtam abhayam etat brahma iti
translated: This is immortality, this is fearlessness, this is Brahman.

original: tasya ha vā etasya brahmaṇo nāma satyam iti // / / //
analyzed: tasya ha vai etasya brahmaṇaḥ nāma satyam iti
translated: And the name of this Brahman is Truth.

original: atha ya ātmā sa setur dhṛtir eṣāṃ lokānām asaṃbhedāya /
analyzed: atha yaḥ ātmā sa setuḥ dhṛtiḥ eṣām lokānām a saṃbhedāya
translated: And this Self is the dam, the support, for the non-separation of these worlds.

original: naitaṃ setum ahorātre tarato na jarā na mṛtyur na śoko na sukṛtam /
analyzed: na etam setum ahar rātre tarataḥ na jarā na mṛtyuḥ na śokaḥ na sukṛtam
translated: Neither day nor night cross over this dam, nor old age, nor death, nor grief, nor good deeds.

analyzed: sarve pāpmānaḥ tasmāt nivartante
translated: All evils turn away from this.

analyzed: apahata pāpmā hi eṣa brahma lokaḥ
translated: For this world of Brahman is indeed free from evil.

original: tasmād vā etaṃ setuṃ tīrtvā andhaḥ sann anandho bhavati /🔽viddhaḥ sann aviddho bhavati /
analyzed: tasmāt vai etam setum tīrtvā andhaḥ san an andhaḥ bhavati  viddhaḥ san a viddhaḥ bhavati
translated: Therefore, having crossed over this dam, one who is blind becomes not blind.🔽One who is pierced becomes not pierced.

analyzed: upatāpī san an upatāpī bhavati
translated: One who is afflicted becomes not afflicted.

original: tasmād vā etaṃ setuṃ tīrtvā api naktam ahar evābhiniṣpadyate /
analyzed: tasmāt vai etam setum tīrtvā api naktam ahar eva abhiniṣpadyate
translated: Therefore, having crossed over this dam, even at night one comes forth into the day.

analyzed: sakṛt vibhātaḥ hi eva eṣa brahma lokaḥ
translated: For this world of Brahman is indeed always illuminated.

original: tad ya evaitaṃ brahmalokaṃ brahmacaryeṇānuvindanti teṣām evaiṣa brahmalokaḥ /
analyzed: tat ye eva etam brahma lokam brahmacaryeṇa anuvindanti teṣām eva eṣa brahma lokaḥ
translated: Therefore, those who find this world of Brahman through celibacy, for them this is the world of Brahman.

analyzed: teṣām sarveṣu lokeṣu kāmacāraḥ bhavati
translated: For them there is freedom to go as they wish in all the worlds.

original: atha yad yajña ity ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat /
analyzed: atha yat yajñaḥ iti ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat
translated: Now what they call sacrifice, that is indeed celibacy.

original: brahmacaryeṇa hy eva yo jñātā taṃ vindate /
analyzed: brahmacaryeṇa hi eva yaḥ jñātā tam vindate
translated: For by Brahmacharyya alone one who knows finds him.

original: atha yad iṣṭam ity ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat /
analyzed: atha yat iṣṭam iti ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat
translated: And what they call 'sacrifice' is indeed Brahmacharyya.

analyzed: brahmacaryeṇa hi eva iṣṭvā ātmānam anuvindate
translated: For by Brahmacharyya alone, having sacrificed, one finds the self.

original: atha yat sattrāyaṇam ity ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat /
analyzed: atha yat sattrāyaṇam iti ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat
translated: And what they call 'Sattra' is indeed Brahmacharyya.

original: brahmacaryeṇa hy eva sata ātmanas trāṇaṃ vindate /
analyzed: brahmacaryeṇa hi eva sataḥ ātmanaḥ trāṇam vindate
translated: For by Brahmacharyya alone one finds the protection of the existing self.

original: atha yan maunam ity ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat /
analyzed: atha yat maunam iti ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat
translated: And what they call 'silence' is indeed Brahmacharyya.

analyzed: brahmacaryeṇa hi eva ātmānam anuvidya manute
translated: For by Brahmacharyya alone, having found the self, one thinks.

original: atha yad anāśakāyanam ity ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat /
analyzed: atha yat anāśakāyanam iti ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat
translated: And what they call 'non-starvation' is indeed Brahmacharyya.

original: eṣa hy ātmā na naśyati yaṃ brahmacaryeṇānuvindate /
analyzed: eṣa hi ātmā na naśyati yam brahmacaryeṇa anuvindate
translated: For this self does not perish which one finds by Brahmacharyya.

original: atha yad araṇyāyanam ity ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat /
analyzed: atha yat araṇyāyanam iti ācakṣate brahmacaryam eva tat
translated: And what they call 'forest-dwelling' is indeed Brahmacharyya.

original: tat araś ca ha vai ṇyaś cārṇavau brahmaloke tṛtīyasyām ito divi /
analyzed: tat araḥ ca ha vai ṇyaḥ ca arṇavau brahma loke tṛtīyasyām itas divi
translated: For Ara and Nya are the two oceans in the world of Brahman, in the third heaven from here.

analyzed: tat airaṃmadīyam saraḥ
translated: That is the lake of Airāmaditya.

analyzed: tat aśvatthaḥ somasavanaḥ
translated: That is the Aśvattha tree, the Soma-press.

original: tad aparājitā pūr brahmaṇaḥ prabhuvimitaṃ hiraṇmayam // / / //
analyzed: tat aparājitā pūḥ brahmaṇaḥ prabhu vimitam hiraṇmayam
translated: That is the imperishable, the golden one measured by the power of Brahman.

original: tad ya evaitāv araṃ ca ṇyaṃ cārṇavau brahmaloke brahmacaryeṇānuvindanti teṣām evaiṣa brahmalokaḥ /
analyzed: tat ye eva etau aram ca ṇyam ca arṇavau brahma loke brahmacaryeṇa anuvindanti teṣām eva eṣa brahma lokaḥ
translated: Those who in the world of Brahman find by Brahmacharya these two oceans, the Arā and the Nya, for them this is the world of Brahman.

analyzed: teṣām sarveṣu lokeṣu kāmacāraḥ bhavati
translated: For them there is freedom to go to all the worlds as they wish.

original: atha yā etā hṛdayasya nāḍyas tāḥ piṅgalasyāṇimnas tiṣṭhanti śuklasya nīlasya pītasya lohitasyeti /
analyzed: atha yāḥ etāḥ hṛdayasya nāḍyaḥ tāḥ piṅgalasya aṇimnaḥ tiṣṭhanti śuklasya nīlasya pītasya lohitasya iti
translated: Now, these channels of the heart stand in the subtle essence of the tawny, the white, the blue, the yellow, and the red.

original: asau vādityaḥ piṅgala eṣa śukla eṣa nīla eṣa pīta eṣa lohitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: asau vā ādityaḥ piṅgalaḥ eṣa śuklaḥ eṣa nīlaḥ eṣa pītaḥ eṣa lohitaḥ
translated: This sun is the tawny, this is the white, this is the blue, this is the yellow, this is the red.

original: tad yathā mahāpatha ātata ubhau grāmau gacchatīmaṃ cāmuṃ caivam evaitā ādityasya raśmaya ubhau lokau gacchantīmaṃ cāmuṃ ca /🔽amuṣmād ādityāt pratāyante tā āsu nāḍīṣu sṛptāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā mahā pathaḥ ātataḥ ubhau grāmau gacchati imam ca amum ca evam eva etāḥ ādityasya raśmayaḥ ubhau lokau gacchanti imam ca amum ca  amuṣmāt ādityāt pratāyante tāḥ āsu nāḍīṣu sṛptāḥ
translated: Just as a great highway goes to both villages, this one and that one, in the same way these rays of the sun go to both worlds, this one and that one.🔽From that sun they spread out and enter those channels.

original: ābhyo nāḍībhyaḥ pratāyante te 'muṣminn āditye sṛptāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ābhyaḥ nāḍībhyaḥ pratāyante te muṣmin āditye sṛptāḥ
translated: From those channels they spread out and enter that sun.

original: tad yatraitat suptaḥ samastaḥ saṃprasannaḥ svapnaṃ na vijānāti /
analyzed: tat yatra etat suptaḥ samastaḥ saṃprasannaḥ svapnam na vijānāti
translated: When one is deeply asleep, at one with the universal Self, and knows no dreams,

analyzed: āsu tadā nāḍīṣu sṛptaḥ bhavati
translated: then one has entered those channels.

analyzed: tam na kaścana pāpmā spṛśati
translated: No evil touches him.

analyzed: tejasā hi tadā saṃpannaḥ bhavati
translated: For then he is endowed with radiance.

analyzed: atha yatra etat a balimānam nītaḥ bhavati
translated: Now when he is brought to weakness,

original: tam abhita āsīnā āhur jānāsi māṃ jānāsi mām iti /
analyzed: tam abhitas āsīnāḥ āhuḥ jānāsi mām jānāsi mām iti
translated: those sitting around him say, Do you know me? Do you know me?

original: sa yāvad asmāc charīrād anutkrānto bhavati /
analyzed: sa yāvat asmāt śarīrāt an utkrāntaḥ bhavati
translated: As long as he has not departed from this body,

analyzed: tāvat jānāti
translated: he knows.

analyzed: atha yatra etat asmāt śarīrāt utkrāmati
translated: Now when he departs from this body,

analyzed: atha etaiḥ eva raśmibhiḥ ūrdhvam ākramate
translated: then he ascends upwards by those very rays.

original: sa om iti vā hod vā mīyate /
analyzed: saḥ om iti vā ha ud vā mīyate
translated: He is measured by Om or Om.

original: sa yāvat kṣipyen manas tāvad ādityaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: sa yāvat kṣipyet manaḥ tāvat ādityam gacchati
translated: As far as he can throw his mind, he goes to the sun.

original: etad vai khalu lokadvāraṃ viduṣāṃ prapadanaṃ nirodho 'viduṣām // / / //
analyzed: etat vai khalu loka dvāram viduṣām prapadanam nirodhaḥ viduṣām
translated: This indeed is the door to the worlds, the path of those who know, the obstruction of those who do not know.

analyzed: tat eṣa ślokaḥ
translated: There is this verse:

original: śataṃ caikā ca hṛdayasya nāḍyas tāsāṃ mūrdhānam abhiniḥsṛtaikā /
analyzed: śatam ca ekā ca hṛdayasya nāḍyaḥ tāsām mūrdhānam abhiniḥsṛtā ekā
translated: There are a hundred and one channels of the heart. Of them, one has gone out to the top of the head.

original: tayordhvam āyann amṛtatvam eti viṣvaṅṅ anyā utkramaṇe bhavanty utkramaṇe bhavanti // / / //
analyzed: tayā ūrdhvam āyan amṛta tvam eti viṣvaṅ anyāḥ utkramaṇe bhavanti utkramaṇe bhavanti
translated: Going upwards through that, one attains immortality. The others are for departing in different directions. They are for departing in different directions.

original: ya ātmā apahatapāpmā vijaro vimṛtyur viśoko vijighatso 'pipāsaḥ satyakāmaḥ satyasaṃkalpaḥ so 'nveṣṭavyaḥ sa vijijñāsitavyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ātmā apahata pāpmā vijaraḥ vimṛtyuḥ viśokaḥ vijighatsaḥ pipāsaḥ satya kāmaḥ satya saṃkalpaḥ saḥ nveṣṭavyaḥ sa vijijñāsitavyaḥ
translated: He who is the Self, free from evil, free from old age, free from death, free from grief, free from hunger and thirst, having true desires, having true resolves, He should be sought after, He should be desired to be known.

original: sa sarvāṃś ca lokān āpnoti sarvāṃś ca kāmān yas tam ātmānam anuvidya vijānātīti ha prajāpatir uvāca // / / //
analyzed: sa sarvān ca lokān āpnoti sarvān ca kāmān yaḥ tam ātmānam anuvidya vijānāti iti ha prajāpatiḥ uvāca
translated: He who knows Him thus, who knows Him as the Self, obtains all worlds and all desires. Thus did Prajapati declare.

analyzed: tat ha ubhaye deva asurāḥ anububudhire
translated: Now, both the gods and the demons understood that.

original: te hocur hanta tam ātmaānam anvecchāmo yam ātmānam anviṣya sarvāṃś ca lokān āpnoti sarvāṃś ca kāmān iti /
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ hanta tam ātmaānam anvecchāmaḥ yam ātmānam anviṣya sarvān ca lokān āpnoti sarvān ca kāmān iti
translated: They said, Let us seek after that Self, having sought after whom one obtains all worlds and all desires.

analyzed: indraḥ ha eva devānām abhipravavrāja virocanaḥ surāṇām
translated: Indra indeed went forth on behalf of the gods, Virochana on behalf of the demons.

original: tau hāsaṃvidānāv eva samitpāṇī prajāpatisakāśam ājagmatuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tau ha a saṃvidānau eva samidh pāṇī prajāpati sakāśam ājagmatuḥ
translated: They, not in agreement, came to Prajapati with fuel in their hands.

original: tau ha dvātriṃśataṃ varṣāṇi brahmacaryam ūṣatuḥ /
analyzed: tau ha dvātriṃśatam varṣāṇi brahmacaryam ūṣatuḥ
translated: They lived the life of religious studentship for thirty-two years.

analyzed: tau ha prajāpatiḥ uvāca
translated: To them Prajapati said:

analyzed: kim icchantau avāstam iti
translated: What did you desire to live (here)?

original: tau hocatur ya ātmā apahatapāpmā vijaro vimṛtyur viśoko vijighatso 'pipāsaḥ satyakāmaḥ satyasaṃkalpaḥ so 'nveṣṭavyaḥ sa vijijñāsitavyaḥ /
analyzed: tau ha ūcatuḥ yaḥ ātmā apahata pāpmā vijaraḥ vimṛtyuḥ viśokaḥ vijighatsaḥ pipāsaḥ satya kāmaḥ satya saṃkalpaḥ saḥ nveṣṭavyaḥ sa vijijñāsitavyaḥ
translated: They said, 'That Self which is free from evil, free from old age, free from death, free from grief, free from hunger and thirst, having truth for its desire and resolve, He should be sought after, He should be sought to know.

original: sa sarvāṃś ca lokān āpnoti sarvāṃś ca kāmān yas tam ātmānam anuvidya vijānātīti bhagavato vaco vedayante /
analyzed: sa sarvān ca lokān āpnoti sarvān ca kāmān yaḥ tam ātmānam anuvidya vijānāti iti bhagavataḥ vacaḥ vedayante
translated: He obtains all worlds and all desires who, having found that Self, knows Him.' Thus they declare the words of the Blessed One.

analyzed: tam icchantau avāstam iti
translated: Desiring Him, they went to Prajapati.

original: tau ha prajāpatir uvāca ya eṣo 'kṣiṇi puruṣo dṛṣyata eṣa ātmeti hovāca /
analyzed: tau ha prajāpatiḥ uvāca yaḥ eṣa u kṣiṇi puruṣaḥ dṛṣyate eṣaḥ ātmā iti ha uvāca
translated: Prajapati said to them, 'The person seen in the eye, He is the Self,' he said.

analyzed: etat amṛtam abhayam etat brahma iti
translated: 'This is the immortal, the fearless, this is Brahman.'

original: atha yo 'yaṃ bhagavo 'psu parikhyāyate yaś cāyam ādarśe katama eṣa iti /
analyzed: atha yaḥ yam bhagavaḥ upsu parikhyāyate yaḥ ca ayam ādarśe katamaḥ eṣaḥ iti
translated: Then he who is proclaimed in the waters and he who is in the mirror, which one is he?

original: eṣa u evaiṣu sarveṣvannteṣu parikhyāyata iti hovāca // / / //
analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva eṣu sarveṣu annteṣu parikhyāyate iti ha uvāca
translated: He said, 'He is proclaimed in all these infinite (things).'

original: udaśarāva ātmānam avekṣya yad ātmano na vijānīthas tan me prabrūtam iti /
analyzed: uda śarāve ātmānam avekṣya yat ātmanaḥ na vijānīthaḥ tat me prabrūtam iti
translated: Looking at the Self in the water-pot, tell me what you do not know about the Self.'

analyzed: tau ha udaśarāve vekṣām cakrāte
translated: They looked at the water-pot.

original: tau ha prajāpatir uvāca kiṃ paśyatha iti /
analyzed: tau ha prajāpatiḥ uvāca kim paśyathaḥ iti
translated: Prajapati said to them, 'What do you see?'

original: tau hocatuḥ sarvam evedam āvāṃ bhagava ātmānaṃ paśyāva ā lomabhyaḥ ā nakhebhyaḥ pratirūpam iti // / / //
analyzed: tau ha ūcatuḥ sarvam eva idam āvām bhagavaḥ ātmānam paśyāvaḥ ā lomabhyaḥ ā nakhebhyaḥ pratirūpam iti
translated: They said, 'We see the whole of this Self, O revered one, down to the hair, down to the nails, in its true form.'

original: tau ha prajāpatir uvāca sādhvalaṃkṛtau suvasanau pariṣkṛtau bhūtvodaśarāve 'vekṣethām iti /
analyzed: tau ha prajāpatiḥ uvāca sādhu alaṃkṛtau su vasanau pariṣkṛtau bhūtvā uda śarāve vekṣethām iti
translated: Prajapati said to them, 'Having adorned yourselves well, having put on good clothes, having been purified, look into a bowl of water.'

original: tau ha sādhvalaṃkṛtau suvasanau pariṣkṛtau bhūtvodaśarāve 'vekṣāṃ cakrāte /
analyzed: tau ha sādhu alaṃkṛtau su vasanau pariṣkṛtau bhūtvā uda śarāve vekṣām cakrāte
translated: Having adorned themselves well, having put on good clothes, having been purified, they looked into a bowl of water.

original: tau ha prajāpatir uvāca kiṃ paśyatha iti // / / //
analyzed: tau ha prajāpatiḥ uvāca kim paśyathaḥ iti
translated: Prajapati said to them, 'What do you see?'

original: tau hocatur yathaivedam āvāṃ bhagavaḥ sādhvalaṃkṛtau suvasanau pariṣkṛtau sva evam evemau bhagavaḥ sādhvallaṃkṛtau suvasanau pariṣkṛtāv iti
analyzed: tau ha ūcatuḥ yathā eva idam āvām bhagavaḥ sādhu alaṃkṛtau su vasanau pariṣkṛtau svaḥ evam eva imau bhagavaḥ sādhu allaṃkṛtau su vasanau pariṣkṛtau iti
translated: They said, 'As we, O revered one, are well-adorned, well-clothed, and purified, so are we, O revered one, well-adorned, well-clothed, and purified.'

analyzed: eṣaḥ ātmā iti ha uvāca
translated: He said, 'This is the Self.'

analyzed: etat amṛtam abhayam etat brahma iti
translated: 'This is the immortal, the fearless, this is Brahman.'

analyzed: tau ha śānta hṛdayau pravavrajatuḥ
translated: With tranquil hearts they went away.

analyzed: tau ha anvīkṣya prajāpatiḥ uvāca
translated: Having observed them, Prajapati said,

original: anupalabhyātmānam ananuvidya vrajato yatara etadupaniṣado bhaviṣyanti devā vā asurā vā te parābhaviṣyantīti /
analyzed: an upalabhya ātmānam an anuvidya vrajataḥ yatare etad upaniṣadaḥ bhaviṣyanti devāḥ vā asurāḥ vā te parābhaviṣyanti iti
translated: 'Those who will go without realizing the Self and without understanding the Upanishads, whether they be gods or demons, will be defeated.'

original: sa ha śāntahṛdaya eva virocano 'surāñ jagāma /
analyzed: sa ha śānta hṛdayaḥ eva virocano surām jagāma
translated: He, Virocana, with a tranquil heart, went to the demons.

original: tebhyo haitām upaniṣadaṃ provāca ātmaiveha mahayya ātmā paricaryaḥ /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ha etām upaniṣadam provāca ātmā eva iha mahayyaḥ ātmā paricaryaḥ
translated: To them he proclaimed this Upanishad: The Self should be worshipped here, the Self should be served.

original: ātmānam eveha mahayann ātmānaṃ paricarann ubhau lokāv āpnotīmaṃ cāmuṃ ceti // / / //
analyzed: ātmānam eva iha mahayan ātmānam paricaran ubhau lokau āpnoti imam ca amum ca iti
translated: By worshipping the Self here, by serving the Self, one attains both worlds, this world and the next.

original: tasmād apyaddyehādadānam aśraddadhānam ayajamānam āhur āsuro bateti /
analyzed: tasmāt api addyā iha ādadānam aśraddadhānam ayajamānam āhuḥ āsuraḥ bata iti
translated: Therefore, even today, they call one who does not give, who is faithless, who does not sacrifice, O, he is of the demons.

analyzed: asurāṇām hi eṣā upaniṣad
translated: For this is the Upanishad of the demons.

analyzed: pretasya śarīram bhikṣayā vasanena alaṃkāreṇa iti saṃskurvanti
translated: They purify the body of the deceased with alms, clothing, and ornaments.

original: etena hy ammuṃ lokaṃ jeṣyanto manyante // / / //
analyzed: etena hi am mum lokam jeṣyantaḥ manyante
translated: For by this they think they will conquer the other world.

original: atha hendro 'prāpyaiva devān etad bhayaṃ dadarśa /
analyzed: atha ha indraḥ prāpya eva devān etat bhayam dadarśa
translated: Then Indra, not having attained the gods, saw this fear:

original: yathaiva khalv ayam asmiñ charīre sādhvalaṃkṛte sādhvalaṃkṛto bhavati suvasane suvasanaḥ
analyzed: yathā eva khalu ayam asmin śarīre sādhu alaṃkṛte sādhu alaṃkṛtaḥ bhavati su vasane su vasanaḥ
translated: Just as, indeed, when this body is well adorned, it becomes well adorned; when it is well clothed, it becomes well clothed;

original: pariṣkṛte pariṣkṛta evam evāyam asminn andhe 'ndho bhavati srāme srāmaḥ parivṛkṇe parivṛkṇaḥ /
analyzed: pariṣkṛte pariṣkṛte evam eva ayam asmin andhe ndhaḥ bhavati srāme srāmaḥ parivṛkṇe parivṛkṇaḥ
translated: when it is well groomed, it becomes well groomed; in the same way, this [self] becomes blind when this [body] is blind, lame when this [body] is lame, mutilated when this [body] is mutilated.

original: asyaiva śarīrasya nāśam anv eṣa naśyati /
analyzed: asya eva śarīrasya nāśam anu eṣa naśyati
translated: It perishes along with the destruction of this very body.

analyzed: na aham atra bhogyam paśyāmi iti
translated: I do not see anything to be enjoyed here.'

analyzed: sa samidh pāṇiḥ punar eyāya
translated: He came back with a bundle of sacrificial fuel in his hand.

analyzed: tam ha prajāpatiḥ uvāca
translated: Prajapati said to him:

original: maghavan yac chāntahṛdayaḥ prāvrājīḥ sārdhaṃ virocanena kim icchan punar āgama iti /
analyzed: maghavan yat śānta hṛdayaḥ prāvrājīḥ sārdham virocanena kim icchan punar āgamaḥ iti
translated: 'O Maghavan (Indra), why have you come back, with a tranquil heart, together with Virochana, desiring what?'

original: sa hovāca yathā eva khalvayyaṃ bhagavo 'smiñ charīre sādhvalaṃkṛte sādhvalaṃkṛto
analyzed: sa ha uvāca yathā eva khalu ayyam śarīre sādhu alaṃkṛte sādhu alaṃkṛtaḥ
translated: He said: 'Just as, O revered one, when this body is well adorned, it becomes well adorned,

original: bhavati suvasane suvasanaḥ pariṣkṛte pariṣkṛta evam evāyam asminn andhe 'ndho bhavati
analyzed: bhavati su vasane su vasanaḥ pariṣkṛte pariṣkṛte evam eva ayam asmin andhe ndhaḥ bhavati
translated: when well clothed, well clothed, when well groomed, well groomed, in the same way, this (soul) becomes blind when this (body) is blind,

analyzed: srāme srāmaḥ parivṛkṇe parivṛkṇaḥ
translated: lame when it is lame, mutilated when it is mutilated.

original: asyaiva śarīrasya nāśam anv eṣa naśyati /
analyzed: asya eva śarīrasya nāśam anu eṣa naśyati
translated: It perishes along with the destruction of this very body.

analyzed: na aham atra bhogyam paśyāmi iti
translated: I do not see anything to be enjoyed here.'

analyzed: evam eva eṣa maghavan iti ha uvāca
translated: 'Even so, O Maghavan (Indra),' he said.

original: etaṃ tv eva te bhūyo 'nuvyākhyāsyāmi /🔽vasāparāṇi dvātriṃśataṃ varṣāṇīti /
analyzed: etam tu eva te bhūyas nuvyākhyāsyāmi  vasa aparāṇi dvātriṃśatam varṣāṇi iti
translated: 'But I will explain this to you further.🔽Live for another thirty-two years.'

analyzed: sa ha aparāṇi dvātriṃśatam varṣāṇi uvāsa
translated: He lived for another thirty-two years.

analyzed: tasmai ha uvāca
translated: To him he said:

analyzed: yaḥ eṣa svapne mahīyamānaḥ carati eṣaḥ ātmā iti ha uvāca
translated: 'He who moves about being honored in a dream, he is the Self,' he said.

analyzed: etat amṛtam abhayam etat brahma iti
translated: This is immortality, this is fearlessness, this is Brahman.

analyzed: sa ha śānta hṛdayaḥ pravavrāja
translated: He went forth with a tranquil heart.

original: sa hāprāpyaiva devān etad bhayaṃ dadarśa /
analyzed: sa ha a prāpya eva devān etat bhayam dadarśa
translated: He, not having reached the gods, saw this fear.

original: tad yady apīdaṃ śarīram andhaṃ bhavaty anandhaḥ sa bhavati yadi srāmam asrāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat yadi api idam śarīram andham bhavati an andhaḥ sa bhavati yadi srāmam a srāmaḥ
translated: Even though this body becomes blind, he does not become blind; if it is lame, he is not lame.

analyzed: na eva eṣaḥ sya doṣeṇa duṣyati  na vadhena asya hanyate
translated: It is not defiled by its faults.🔽It is not killed by its death.

analyzed: na asya srāmyeṇa srāmaḥ  ghnanti tu eva enam

analyzed: vicchādayantī iva

analyzed: apriya vettā iva bhavati

analyzed: api roditi iva na aham atra bhogyam paśyāmi iti

translated: He returned with a bundle of sacred fuel in his hand.

analyzed: tam ha prajāpatiḥ uvāca
translated: Prajapati said to him:

analyzed: sa ha aparāṇi dvātriṃśatam varṣāṇi uvāsa

analyzed: tat yatra etat suptaḥ samastaḥ saṃprasannaḥ svapnam na vijānāti eṣaḥ ātmā iti ha uvāca
translated: When one is asleep, completely at rest, and does not know any dreams, that is the Self, he said.

analyzed: etat amṛtam abhayam etat brahma iti
translated: That is the immortal, the fearless. That is Brahman.

analyzed: sa ha śānta hṛdayaḥ pravavrāja
translated: With a tranquil heart he wandered forth.

analyzed: sa ha a prāpya eva devān etat bhayam dadarśa
translated: He, not having reached the gods, saw this fear.

original: nāha khalv ayam evaṃ saṃpraty ātmānaṃ jānāty ayam aham asmīti /
analyzed: na aha khalu ayam evam saṃprati ātmānam jānāti ayam aham asmi iti
translated: Surely, he does not know the Self now as 'I am that.'

analyzed: na u eva imāni bhūtāni
translated: Nor these beings.

analyzed: vināśam eva api itas bhavati
translated: He goes to destruction alone.

analyzed: na aham atra bhogyam paśyāmi iti
translated: I do not see anything enjoyable in this.

analyzed: sa samidh pāṇiḥ punar eyāya
translated: He returned with a bundle of sacred grass in his hand.

analyzed: tam ha prajāpatiḥ uvāca maghavan yat śānta hṛdayaḥ prāvrājīḥ kim icchan punar āgamaḥ iti
translated: Prajapati said to him, O Maghavan, why have you come back, desiring this, with a tranquil heart, having wandered forth?

translated: He said, 'Verily, revered sir, he does not know the Self in this way now, I am that Self.

analyzed: na u eva imāni bhūtāni
translated: Nor these beings.

analyzed: vināśam eva api itas bhavati
translated: He goes to destruction.

analyzed: na aham atra bhogyam paśyāmi iti
translated: I do not see anything to be enjoyed in this.'

analyzed: evam eva eṣa maghavan iti ha uvāca
translated: 'So it is, O Maghavan,' he said.

analyzed: etam tu eva te bhūyas nuvyākhyāsyāmi
translated: 'But I will explain it to you again.

analyzed: na u eva anyatra etasmāt
translated: There is nothing else but that.

analyzed: vasa aparāṇi pañca varṣāṇi iti
translated: Live with me for five more years.'

analyzed: sa ha aparāṇi pañca varṣāṇi uvāsa
translated: He lived with him for five more years.

analyzed: tāni ekaśatam saṃpeduḥ
translated: They made up a hundred and one years.

analyzed: etat tat yat āhuḥ
translated: This is what they say:

original: ekaśataṃ ha vai varṣāṇi maghavān prajāpatau brahmacaryam uvāsa /
analyzed: ekaśatam ha vai varṣāṇi maghavān prajāpatau brahmacaryam uvāsa
translated: Maghavan lived the life of a religious student for a hundred and one years with Prajapati.

analyzed: tasmai ha uvāca
translated: To him he said:

original: maghavan martyaṃ vā idaṃ śarīram āttaṃ mṛtyunā /
analyzed: maghavan martyam vai idam śarīram āttam mṛtyunā
translated: 'This body, O Maghavan, is mortal, and is seized by death.

analyzed: tat asya amṛtasya aśarīrasya ātmanaḥ dhiṣṭhānam  āttaḥ vai sa śarīraḥ priya apriyābhyām
translated: It is the abode of this immortal, bodiless Self.🔽The embodied one is indeed seized by what is dear and what is not dear.

original: na vai saśarīrasya sataḥ priyāpriyayor apahatir asti /
analyzed: na vai sa śarīrasya sataḥ priya apriyayoḥ apahatiḥ asti
translated: For one who is embodied, there is no removal of what is dear and what is not dear.

original: aśarīraṃ vāva santaṃ na priyāpriye spṛśataḥ // / / //
analyzed: aśarīram vāva santam na priya apriye spṛśataḥ
translated: When one is bodiless, what is dear and what is not dear do not touch him.'

analyzed: aśarīraḥ vāyuḥ
translated: The bodiless one is indeed the wind.

analyzed: abhram vidyut stanayitnuḥ aśarīrāṇi etāni
translated: The cloud, the lightning, and the thunder are bodiless.

original: tad yathaitāny amuṣmād ākāśāt samutthāya paraṃ jyotir upasaṃpadya svena rūpeṇābhiniṣpadyante // / / //
analyzed: tat yathā etāni amuṣmāt ākāśāt samutthāya param jyotiḥ upasaṃpadya svena rūpeṇa abhiniṣpadyante
translated: Just as these, rising from this space, attain the supreme light and manifest in their own form,

original: evam evaiṣa saṃprasādo 'smāc charīrāt samutthāya paraṃ jyotir upasaṃpadya svena rūpeṇābhiniṣpadyate /
analyzed: evam eva eṣa saṃprasādaḥ u smāt śarīrāt samutthāya param jyotiḥ upasaṃpadya svena rūpeṇa abhiniṣpadyate
translated: in the same way, this serene being, rising from this body, attains the supreme light and manifests in its own form.

analyzed: saḥ uttama puruṣaḥ
translated: That is the supreme person.

original: sa tatra paryeti jakṣat krīḍan ramamāṇaḥ strībhir vā yānair vā jñātibhir vā nopajanaṃ smarann idaṃ śarīram /
analyzed: sa tatra paryeti jakṣat krīḍan ramamāṇaḥ strībhiḥ vā yānaiḥ vā jñātibhiḥ vā na upajanam smaran idam śarīram
translated: There he moves about, eating, playing, enjoying, not remembering the body, with women, vehicles, or relatives.

original: sa yathā prayogya ācaraṇe yukta evam evāyam asmiñ charīre prāṇo yuktaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa yathā prayogyaḥ ācaraṇe yuktaḥ evam eva ayam asmin śarīre prāṇaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: Just as a puppet is controlled by the strings, in the same way, the life force in this body is controlled.

original: atha yatraitad ākāśam anuviṣaṇṇaṃ cakṣuḥ sa cākṣuṣaḥ puruṣo darśanāya cakṣuḥ /
analyzed: atha yatra etat ākāśam anuviṣaṇṇam cakṣuḥ sa cākṣuṣaḥ puruṣaḥ darśanāya cakṣuḥ
translated: Now, where the eye is connected with this space, that is the eye-related person for the purpose of seeing. The eye is for seeing.

original: atha yo vededaṃ jighrāṇīti sa ātmā gandhāya ghrāṇam /
analyzed: atha yaḥ veda idam jighrāṇi iti saḥ ātmā gandhāya ghrāṇam
translated: Now, he who knows, I shall smell this, that is the self. The nose is for smelling.

original: atha yo vededam abhivyāharāṇīti sa ātmā abhivyāhārāya vāk /
analyzed: atha yaḥ veda idam abhivyāharāṇi iti saḥ ātmā abhivyāhārāya vāc
translated: Now, he who knows, I shall speak this, that is the self. Speech is for speaking.

original: atha yo vededaṃ śṛṇvānīti sa ātmā śravaṇāya śrotram // / / //
analyzed: atha yaḥ veda idam śṛṇvāni iti saḥ ātmā śravaṇāya śrotram
translated: Now, he who knows, I shall hear this, that is the self. The ear is for hearing.

original: atha yo vededaṃ manvānīti sa ātmā /
analyzed: atha yaḥ veda idam manvāni iti saḥ ātmā
translated: Now, he who knows this and thinks about it, is the Self.

analyzed: manaḥ sya daivam cakṣuḥ
translated: The mind is his divine eye.

original: sa vā eṣa etena daivena cakṣuṣā manasaitān kāmān paśyan ramate ya ete brahmaloke // / / //
analyzed: sa vai eṣaḥ etena daivena cakṣuṣā manasā etān kāmān paśyan ramate ye ete brahma loke
translated: He, indeed, by that divine eye, the mind, beholding those desires which are in the world of Brahman, delights himself.

original: taṃ vā etaṃ devā ātmānam upāsate /
analyzed: tam vai etam devāḥ ātmānam upāsate
translated: The gods worship that Self.

original: tasmāt teṣāṃ sarve ca lokā āttāḥ sarve ca kāmāḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt teṣām sarve ca lokāḥ āttāḥ sarve ca kāmāḥ
translated: Therefore, all the worlds and all the desires are obtained by them.

original: sa sarvāṃś ca lokān āpnoti sarvāṃś ca kāmān yas tam ātmānam anuvidya vijānāti /
analyzed: sa sarvān ca lokān āpnoti sarvān ca kāmān yaḥ tam ātmānam anuvidya vijānāti
translated: He obtains all the worlds and all the desires who, knowing that Self, understands it.

original: iti ha prajāpatir uvāca prajāpatir uvāca // / / //🔽śyāmāc chabalaṃ prapadye /
analyzed: iti ha prajāpatiḥ uvāca prajāpatiḥ uvāca  śyāmāt śabalam prapadye
translated: Thus did Prajapati say. Prajapati said.🔽I take refuge in the variegated from the dark.

analyzed: śabalāt śyāmam prapadye
translated: I take refuge in the dark from the variegated.

original: aśva iva romāṇi vidhūya pāpaṃ candra iva rāhor mukhāt pramucya dhūtvā śarīram akṛtaṃ kṛtātmā brahmalokam abhisaṃbhavāmīty abhisaṃbhavāmīti
analyzed: aśvaḥ iva romāṇi vidhūya pāpam candraḥ iva rāhoḥ mukhāt pramucya dhūtvā śarīram a kṛtam kṛtātmā brahma lokam abhisaṃbhavāmi iti abhisaṃbhavāmi iti
translated: Shaking off evil like a horse shakes off its hairs, and being freed from the mouth of Rahu like the moon, having shaken off the uncreated body, the created soul, I attain the world of Brahman, I attain.

analyzed: ākāśaḥ vai nāma nāma rūpayoḥ nirvahitā
translated: Space, indeed, is called the expander of name and form.

original: te yadantarā tad brahma tad amṛtaṃ sa ātmā /
analyzed: te yat antarā tat brahma tat amṛtam saḥ ātmā
translated: That which is between them is Brahman, that is the immortal, that is the Self.

original: prajāpateḥ sabhāṃ veśma prapadye yaśo 'haṃ bhavāmi brāhmaṇānāṃ yaśo rājñām yaśo viśām /
analyzed: prajāpateḥ sabhām veśma prapadye yaśaḥ ham bhavāmi brāhmaṇānām yaśaḥ rājñām yaśaḥ viśām
translated: I enter the house, the assembly hall of Prajapati. May I become the glory of Brahmins, the glory of kings, the glory of the common people.

analyzed: yaśaḥ ham anuprāpatsi
translated: May I attain glory.

analyzed: sa ha aham yaśasām yaśaḥ
translated: I am the glory of glories.

original: śyetam adatkam adatkaṃ śyetaṃ lindu mābhigāṃ lindu mābhigām // / / //
analyzed: śyetam adatkam adatkam śyetam lindu mā abhigām lindu mā abhigām
translated: May I not go to the white, the eater, the eater, the white, the limping, may I not go to the limping.

original: tad dhaitad brahmā prajāpataya uvāca prajāpatir manave manuḥ prajābhyaḥ /🔽ācāryakulād vedam adhītya yathāvidhānaṃ guroḥ karmātiśeṣeṇābhisamāvṛtya kuṭumbe śucau
analyzed: tat ha etat brahmā prajāpataye uvāca prajāpatiḥ manave manuḥ prajābhyaḥ  ācārya kulāt vedam adhītya yathā vidhānam guroḥ karma atiśeṣeṇa abhisamāvṛtya kuṭumbe śucau
translated: That, indeed, Brahma spoke to Prajapati, Prajapati to Manu, Manu to the people.🔽Having studied the Veda in the teacher's family according to the rules, having completed the duties to the teacher, in a pure household,

original: deśe svādhyāyam adhīyāno dharmikān vidadhad ātmani sarvendriyāṇi saṃpratiṣṭhāpyāhiṃsan

translated: in a clean place, studying the sacred texts, establishing the self in righteous conduct, not harming

translated: any beings except at sacred fords.

original: sa khalv evaṃ vartayan yāvad āyuṣaṃ brahmalokam abhisaṃpadyate /
analyzed: sa khalu evam vartayan yāvat āyuṣam brahma lokam abhisaṃpadyate
translated: He, living thus, attains the world of Brahma for as long as he lives.
